 I am a little disappointed that although iRobot used our data to create the zone system for the newer robots they didn’t update our app system on the older versions to do this as they implied when I consented to them using our mapping data in the beginning. 

Now after years of bumping into things she has a little trouble fully returning home to charge but this is intermittent. 

New rollers were a must after about 2.5 years , and after a while of emptying the bin in out trash can the bottom is slightly cracked but still functional for now. No problems with much of anything else.

title: Performance
text: I can’t thank you enough for creating the Roomba. I have two dogs and thought my house was clean till I got a Roomba 980. I run it every day and I am amazed at the amount of dog hair it picks up. I have Pergo flooring and area rugs and it performs fantastically on everything. My house now looks clean instead of having tumbleweeds of dog hair throughout. And it leaves vacuum marks on the carpet just like a real vacuum does. If it happens to bump into a dog, it stops moving, so I don’t have to worry about their safety. It cleans the entire house, and self docs when battery is low. Only suggestions I would have for improvement would be to make it quieter, give it a larger debris collection bin and engineer it so it can run in the dark. But overall, extremely satisfied. Thanks for making a great product!

title: Nightmare!  Beware!
text:
I bought the s9+ with the mop for Christmas.   I spent a 1500 dollars for the combo.  Setup was easy but trading the s9 to map the house was a challenge. Nevertheless the robo mapped the house, and it worked great, the app not so much, crashes on the phone and isn’t 100% responsive.

However I was impressed to say the least with the robot mop and vacuum until it broke today. The s9 started slamming into the wall over and over again. Having only used it for 3 weeks I figured support would be very helpful.  

What a nightmare, first I tried online where the guy told me if I need replacement parts I’d get 15% off.  Really?  I just bought it, it better not need parts and I have to pay?  After getting nowhere I called in.  I spent 40 mins on the phone with India support who spent a lot of time getting a video to.  After viewing the video they decided there computers could only here see so much so they wanted me to install a app.  I finally had enough back and forth and told the lady I just wanted my money back.

After that they agreed to send me a new one!  Yay!  Or so I thought, she said after we get off the phone I get a email with the shipping label.  Never happened.  

What a shame, if iRobot is going to expect people to buy something so expensive, they should have better support.  Tomorrow I’m calling back and just getting a refund, this not worth my time to play games with support.

title: Misleading, app doesn’t do any of what it claims
text: I had a deebot robot before getting a Roomba. I was excited when I saw all the features included with the app. My old robot had an app as well but I expected my 7 year old robot to be more outdated. I was wrong. This app claims it can have favorites and schedule jobs and see maps but I can’t even see its battery life in the app. When I click favorites it shows me a half glitch screen that says “coming soon”. Literally the only thing I can do is hit start and then see for how many minutes it has been cleaning. You can schedule it to clean but this is useless for me since you have to pick up everything off the floor anyways. No way I’m going to deal with that when I’m running out the door to go to work in the morning. I think the actual robot is ok but don’t get it based off the “high tech app”. Really frustrating that I can’t even see battery life. It doesn’t even connect to my WiFi half the time.

title: Best, but a lot to improve
text: Tried a number of cleaning robots. This is the best in class. However it is not without nits. Hope iRobot product managers will listen. 1) the robot tends to drunk walk (walk in zigzag lines) after awhile - not very efficient. The support says it may be due to lighting, but it is not. Please fix it! 2) the robot doesn’t get better by learning from each cleaning, despite what the company promises. It gets worse over time. Then you have to re-train the robot 3) saving map after each cleaning will wipe out all the schedules. Not sure why they have to do that. Not very smart. 3) the Alexa integration is lousy. I have two robots. It can never get the Alexa commands right. C’mon iRobot! Other than those, I’m quite satisfied.

title: Great product
text: I have a Roomba 960, and use the iRobot Home app.  The 960 works wonderfully, and the app is a good feature.  Having said that though, I do wish the app was able to do more.  With the older Roomba’s one could just pick the robot up and place it in a specific area if you wanted that area cleaned a bit better.  The newer models “know” where they are though, and you aren’t supposed to pick them up and place them someplace new.  I like that the robot knows where it is, and is cleaning based on that knowledge, but if I want the little guy to go back over an area, the only choice I have is to tell it to clean (everything) again.  Here are two suggestions a) allow the owner to drive the robot to a specific area via the app, or b) even better, allow the owner to pinpoint a specific spot, or area on the map created by the robot.

title: Roomba i7
text:
We have no small children anymore, no pets anymore, and the 2 of us are not prone to creating messes. Our Roomba has been a wonderful help to us. We both have back issues. Once a week we send our robot on a mission to clean the floors. So far, so good. 
I think the best help advice we received was to take the time to send the robot on mapping missions. After 3 mapping runs, the robot established a whole house map. I easily labeled the rooms. Now, I am able to specify the rooms I want vacuumed, in the order I’d like the rooms vacuumed. 
We have thoroughly enjoyed the Roomba i7. We do not have a cluttered house so room prep is not an issue. 
I would recommend this vacuuming robot. 
(Now, if the inventors could figure out how to teach it to dust…!)

title: I love my Roomba!
text: As a new mom I absolutely love my Roomba! It cleans amazingly! I have wall to wall polished concrete floors with area rugs scattered throughout. It makes them feel so clean. I can schedule it and go on about my day. It makes life so much easier. Only thing I don’t like is that it can never clean without having to stop and recharge. It will say the job is estimated to take 55 mins for three of my rooms (not even close to the whole house) and it will still have to dock and recharge to finish. I typically do a quick walk around before scheduling any jobs just to make sure it doesn’t get caught up on anything (dog toys, baby clothing/toys, socks, ect.) ultimately I love it so much I would hate to go without I just wish it would be able to get in and finish and not have to dock every time to charge.

title: Cleaning personalized.
text:
This app has given me the piece of mind in making sure that my house is cleaned properly. It also allows me to customize cleaning zones, times, schedules and create favorites. I have connected my Roomba i6 to my google home and it helps me control the Roomba with voice command. 
I would love for this app is to show me where my roomba is cleaning presently. There is no way of finding that out unless in person or until after the job is completed. Also, at the beginning there is no indication that in order to show a map of the house, it needs to complete 2 runs. I thought my roomba wasn’t doing it’s job and was about to give up on it. It would have been nice if there was a way for the app to allow a step by step mapping of the house. 
Altogether an amazing app.

title: Suggestion
text:
I really love my s9 mop and vacuum but I wish there was an option/upgrade to the system that would allow the user to override the robots mapping. 

My mop is placed in the living room which has a wood transition that’s apparently more than 3mm high. Because of this it will go halfway up it then stop because it thinks it’s a carpet or something. I wish there was a way to tell it to continue over it. Also, it for some reason won’t go to a corner of the living room, it always stops and turns around before making it to that area. 

I think I’m the mapping system my vacuum has gotten almost all the areas so I feel like there should be a way to take that map and edit it to work for the mop as well so it’s programmed to know where it can basically “follow” the vacuum

title: Great product for blind people
text: I have had the robot vacuum cleaner since they first came out. The first ones were totally abysmal because it was no way I could find it once it was gone. Once its battery was dead. The second one was better I was able to find that one because it would go back to its charging dock that I got the third one is great because I can actually with the help of a sighted person doing the map target certain rooms in certain places in my home. The one thing that you did to help me is that you actually made the battery status available for me to see or actually here. It now says if it’s medium low full charge whatever this is great. Please keep accessibility

title: Rough start but now love it
text: We started off for a little rocky. Our first vacuum couldn’t keep a connection to our Internet for more than a few minutes. And because of some difficult software, reconnecting it was always a pain. After a few weeks it stopped connecting at all and we returned it to Costco and got a new one. While customer service was being helpful with our issues, getting them to admit we just had more then a internet problem was difficult.  We’ve now had the new one for six months it’s never lost connection it has been working so well we upgraded to the irobot 6.  We now have one on each floor of our house and they do a great job. We have a dog that sheds so upgrading to a basket that empties was a game changer for us.

title: Not consistent
text:
When my robot, Reginald, is working well, everything is great. However, when he’s not, anything can happen. Examples:

     1. Says he’s charging, but isn’t. 
     2. Does not connect to Wifi, so I 
          can’t talk to him. 
     3. Has trouble docking. 

To get him to charge, I have to wiggle him around on the connectors until it works. Sometimes that takes awhile. Not only is that making more work for me, but it also means if I’m not home when he stops to recharge during cleaning, he can’t finish the job because he times out. 

When not connected to Wifi, it can be several hours to several days before suddenly connecting again. We have checked the Wifi and nothing else in the house is having problems. 

Docking is just a mystery. When working 
right, he’s perfect. But he can sometimes end up in the strangest places, and just stops. Moving the dock to a different place has not helped, and neither has providing more light. 

I sent him in to be fixed once. He might be a little better, but it’s hard to tell, since it is all  sporadic. 

Well, you asked. Sorry to write a book, but any help we can get would be appreciated. I LOVE my robot, when he’s being cooperative! Thanks for listening.

title: Roomba with base
text: We live on some land in the country with 3 large dogs that constantly shed.  Our home has stained concrete floors with a few rugs.  We’ve had our i7 Roomba with base for almost 2 years and it’s setup to clean daily.  It does get stuck here and there. We have to routinely clean the main rollers, brushes and dust bin.  The regular maintenance and upkeep is 100% absolutely worth it.  Our floors are always clean especially the dirt and sand tracked in by our dogs. I love being able to use the app to sweep specific areas.  I love being able to setup “keep out zones” during Christmas to keep the Roomba away from the Christmas tree.  We will never go without our Roomba ever again.  I tell every person I know how well it works!

title: Love. IRobot!
text: I have had an iRobot for at least 10 years.  I have the 500 pet series. It was my first. I just got the 900 with the emptying bin and I love it!  The 500 did a good job for many years and I still use it in my office.  I’ve replaced pretty much everything on it. So easy!!  If I could replace the motherboard I would!  The 900 is definitely a superior machine.  It maps out the rooms and stays on schedules.  I can block off areas for my Christmas tree and all that through the app.  I love it.  My only complaint would be the bag.... I wish it was reusable.  I also just got the brava jet and it is ok for a mop.  I use it 3 times a week and it does a decent job cleaning little messes and spots on the floor which is all I expect it to do.

title: Like braava and roomba. Not automatic empty
text: I’ve had a roomba for about 8 years, the 880 model. It was great but not the most powerful motor for carpet.  I got the i3+ and braava.  We do have a dog, that accounts for a great deal of the vacuuming.  The dirt reservoir on the i3 is smaller than that of the 880 but the suction is better.  The automatic self emptying function is likely great for those without pets. This function has clogged every time but one in the several weeks we’ve had it (almost daily cleaning).  I would rather not have the self emptying feature and have a larger dirt reservoir.  I find the rollers harder to remove than on the 880.   I was shocked by how much I like braava. It does a good job.  I was worried it would spray the base of the cabinets, but it doesn’t.    Overall pleased but some new “features” are frustrating.  I with I got the i7 instead of the i3+.

title: Needs constant attention
text: It helps keep the dog hair from accumulating on the hardwood floors. You can definitely tell the days it does not run vs when it completes its rounds. The big problem is it’s always needing some kind of attention. I gets stuck, runs something over, gets jammed, the sensor gets dirty, or it needs its bin changed. It is not capable of running autonomously every day. I find that if I factory reset it every 3 months it does better. The map feature is good but once it’s done “mapping” it will sometimes choose to not go to places. It’s not the end of the world that it needs attention constantly since we have teenagers to help do it but if it was just me I would have thrown it in the garbage by now. It’s also of note that it is now named “Karen” by my kids because it’s always complaining about something. Haha

title: Great App. Great Product.
text: The App works great!! Enough said. It has, almost everything. My only complaint / desire is it needs a toggle feature that allows you to adjust the suction power to a lower setting for times when you are home. The vacuum can be a bit louder then anticipated and compared to my last robot vacuum. I used to have a shark and I know they had an Eco mode (quieter and longer lasting), normal mode and some sort of extra power feature. We could usually switch to eco if the volume bothered. Hope to see a feature like this in the future. I do like the automation though but I still have trust issues running the vacuum to often with out anyone nearby. You know, fires and all that stuff.

title: I robot
text: Love it, it has made my life a ton easier. I have mostly hardwood floors and 1 room with carpet.. it nice because this does both kinds of floors.. it helps control all the foot traffic in the house along with the dog hair from my 2 dogs...  I’ve named it Cookie Monster because my grand kids love cookies and this machine picks up the crumbs... the phone app is great because I’m outside a lot and I can check to see if it got stuck anywhere or if it’s charging etc without having to go hunt it down. I can also start it when I’m away from home.. I’m not big on computer etc, but this app is easy to figure out and set up cleaning schedules without finding where I put the manual every time it has a problem.. can’t say enough about this product love love it!!!

title: Like it. Love it. Could continue to get better.
text:
I would really like to see an app update that shows time to full charge on the Roomba and also an actual battery % rather than a generic battery charge icon. 

Also some kind of tolerance level for the Roomba to give up when it faces an obstacle would be cool. I’ve watched mine occasionally struggle moving from wood to carpet to brick or getting stuck on a stray article of clothing on the floor. Would be nice if I had a setting to say ‘power through it’ or ‘back off if it’s particularly annoying obstacle’ etc. 

I’m new to the Roomba family. So far so good. It’s act better than good I love it. I have three kids under 8 years old and two cats. Between the cat hair and crumbs from the kids the Roomba dames me from vacuuming everyday myself.

title: Rating the New App
text: My intent is to give feedback on the new iRobot app and can find no other place to do it except here. I love the product and for the most part the app is fine. The deficiency in the app that I see is on the scheduling side. The creators of the app will not allow the user to turn off a schedule time without it being erased from the app. Because of my dynamic household (as in living), my preferred times for running the cleaner varies from week to week. This requires me the annoying task of having to start with a pre-programmed schedule of three days and begin the process of eliminating their pre-program settings. Ideally, the App would allow the user to turn off a scheduled cleaning without it being erased. This would allow me the ability the next week simply to press one button and be done with it.

title: Why did I wait so long
text:
A better cleaner than I expected.  Be patient in the beginning, run the mapping runs and just let her do her thing.   With regular runs, I find I don’t need to supplement vacuuming hardly at all.  
I use on hard floor, carpet and floor rugs.  She handles everything well except for bathroom throw rugs so I just pick those up. 
Getting the model with mapping is so worth it.  I love just sending her to clean a room. 

My original vacuum had a computer problem so iRobot replaced it.  Unfortunately it was back ordered so I gad to wait a month.  They were very generous about what they offered me for my trouble.  Thus time without the robot really made me realize how much I missed her and her daily cleaning.

title: Good Could Be Better
text:
The overall design and layout of the app as to the GUI is perfect don’t change a thing. However I think there are some easy customizable things that could be done easily and make the app even better.

Ex) The schedule:
            Right now you only have the option of telling it to work on an exact day Sun-Sat. That works great for some people but not everyone. I work for the fire department and my schedule while routine and regular does not follow a normal week. This is true of many people in similar fields; Police , EMS, hospitals.
             It would be GREAT! If we could set it to clean every X number of day starting on Y calendar date. And another way in addition would have it pull up an actual calendar and let you check mark the days you want it to clean in a month not just week. Basically would like to have more scheduling options.

title: Good vacuum, crappy app
text:
Every time I want to use the app it tells me to physically go to the Roomba and hold down the home button (on the Roomba, not the iPhone) for 2 seconds, then it connects. Every. Single. Time. I have to do this process. That defeats the entire point of the app. I should be able to just open the app and tell it to start cleaning. If I have to hit buttons on the robot first I may as well never use the app. I can’t believe this is how it’s supposed to function so maybe I have a defective unit?

Edit: I managed to get the Roomba to connect by configuring it with static IP information and using Google DNS. Don’t know why it can’t work with DHCP when everything else in my house does...but there ya go. I’ll up my review to 3 stars but that definitely needs to be rectified because most people don’t even know what IP address means.

title: Robot is great the app needs work
text:
I love the robot. The app needs quite a bit of work. When looking at my cleaning history it gives the options to update the smart map. However, if the app feels like the map is out of date it will not let you update the existing map. I don’t care what the app/robot think. That is the map I’d like to use so please allow the option to update a map if I so choose. As for the smart map features, there needs to be an option to draw in/delete actual portions of the home that the robot won’t acknowledge.  Example: my map shows a walkway from my dining room to the bathroom that does not exist. No amount of training runs will fix this. Also, training runs should still be an option once a map reaches “100%.”  

Tl;dr: the app needs lots of new features to give complete control. The robot’s actual ability to clean is very good.

title: It’s a good toddler, or worse....
text: After 3 weeks with it we already had to replace the rollers because the bearings quit. That was real cool. Now it’s just loud every time we run it. It’s seriously like another child. I have to follow it to make sure it does what it’s supposed to do. All that said....I do love it, but more like a family member you’re supposed to love. I have a name for it and it’s like one of my kids. It’s like Pac-Man eating the crap my kids leave behind. I wish it would have better rollers. The fact that it gets everything stuck in it really isn’t easy on the normal consumer. I do not want to continually replace the rollers after I spent X amount on a robot vacuum. I find that to be the big money maker for this company....let’s make cleaning easy, but not care about the parts that will not make life easy for the owners of these! I have the i3, I wish I just had an anteater!!

title: As disgusted as I am pleased
text: We knew we had to make a change based on the regular air filter changed and weekly home cleanup. Our efforts seemed ineffective. Having four dogs will do that. We made the purchase in high hopes and in the first few days we were disgusted to learn just how much filth we were blindly comfortably living in. As the adage goes; ignorance is bliss. Glad we are better educated now and have made our regular cleanings much more effortless, thanks to introducing this one seemingly superficial member to our family. She’s more integral to our wellness and well-being than I could have imagined. We would happily make the purchase again but she’s covered under warranty. 😜 Thank you iRobot.

title: Wonderful!
text: I’ll begin by saying the bin makes all the difference in the world.  Using the app on my phone makes it so easy to operate and give commands.  I have set it up to automatically run three days a week, but if I need it sooner I just open the app and get started.  The self-emptying bin is just an incredible feature, and holds a lot more than one would think.  If you need to vacuum a specific space, just go to the app and point it in that direction.  It works incredibly well on tile and wood, as well as carpet.  It rarely gets “stuck”, but if it does, just go to the app’s location function, and it will start to sing until you find it.  This really is a wonderful vacuum.

title: Would prefer more scheduling
text:
It’s a handy app but it’s slow to connect to the robot and also I’d prefer more scheduling options. As I’m not always at home it would be nice to be able to set her off twice a day as my dogs move through the house and are continuously shedding (one is a beagle). 
It’d be pretty cool if there was a function to set areas and direct her (I’ve dictated gender and named her Ruby. No I do not have a life.) we have a robot lawn mower and it has a secondary and primary area and mows them accordingly. I’d like a function to tell Ruby to clean one room first at 9am and then around 2pm move onto the next section. Maybe mark perimeter with the towers? Realistically the function would be awesome but I move ruby around different floors so either way it would just be a cool function and not life changing.

title: Room for improvement
text:
This app has plenty of room for improvement. Troubleshooting and help is difficult to use and nearly impossible to submit a help request and actually include the information they ask for. My roomba clearly has a problem, yet the app seems to think everything is ok. The roomba makes music and lights up like it is on, but the device doesn’t budge an inch. And the app doesn’t recognize a problem.

Troubleshooting (outside of the usual “clean the dust sensors”) is nonexistent. The app could easily include specific info and troubleshooting for this specific device. Or allow users to submit a question that automatically populates the device’s serial number and model type. It’s pretty useless to try to submit a question only to have to back all the way out to to find the serial number and model. 

We’ve had this roomba for two months and it’s already breaking down. Very disappointed.

title: Getting sloppy
text:
I waited for years to finally get a Roomba.  Purchased a 960 and loved it at first.  It was really learning the layout of the house and doing a great job of replacing our daily vacuuming routine.  All of a sudden the Roomba decided to start getting stuck on everything.  It particularly can’t handle a low pile dark rug that has a light floral pattern in it.  It gets onto the rug and then acts stupid until it dies.  It won’t even touch one of the other black area rugs in the dining room.  I understand the limitations of the system but I know iRobot could do better for how much people pay.
Another issue is their lack of app support.  I’ve been stuck with an app that won’t give notifications (which is helpful to know if the robot completed a job or is helplessly stuck on a terrifying rug).  They are aware of this bug in the app but still have not released an update.  There are tons of people having this issue since the update.  Come on guys.  Let’s get this stuff fixed.

title: Cleaning partner
text: I was very skeptical about buying this vacuum as I wasn’t sure how it could possibly do better than a person sweeping the floor. I have tested it by sweeping some of the dirt towards the baseboards to see if it would pick it all up abs I have swept after the robot stopped vacuuming and both times it had gotten all of the dirt off the floor. When I empty the bin where the dirt etc is collected I am always amazed at how much is in there as he vacuums at least 3 or 4 times per week. This is a great product! I love that I can use the time that it takes to vacuum to do other things and it speeds up my cleaning time. The only downside is that it doesn’t go up and down stairs.

title: Life changing.
text:
This is a review of the app, but also the i7 robot’s implementation of features…

I live in an 850 sq. ft. condo on a beach (lots of sand) and use this app with the Roomba i7. I’ve been using the scheduler to run Mon/Wed/Fri when I’m at work and fewer neighbors are around because it is much quieter than my Shark stick vacuum but noisy enough that I wear my AirPods w/ noise cancellation if I’m at home. The whole process takes ~1hr15min with no recharge or bin emptying. 

I’m a neat freak so I never have random things on the floor but the vacuum has no issues navigating around lamps, chairs, and pouf/ottomans that frequently move. The slim profile fits under all furniture and the overhang of my base kitchen cabinets. The mapping feature works surprisingly well as the exterior walls of my condo are at unusual angles (not 90 degrees).

The “smart” beta features are stable enough they should port over to regular users and there seems to be a good amount of machine learning because the one location that originally caused issues has not been a problem since the first few runs. 

My quality of life entirely justifies the cost.

title: Rosie the Roomba to the rescue
text: I have two dogs and a husband that works in construction. Before I was sweeping at least once a day and it still wasn’t enough. Now our little Rosie does a sweep every other day. It helps with my daily and weekly cleaning. The dogs still get a little antsy when she runs, but I’m so very appreciative of it. Best Christmas present I’ve ever received. My home is about 1900 with carpet and floors. I’ve had her for about a month. She does get a little lost in the house but she usually sends me a text message. I have noticed that if I’m not home when she is running she gets lost or stuck more often. So for me I would rather be in the house when she does.

title: i7+ Amazing!
text:
So nice having the first floor always clean. I can schedule the rooms weekly at first light before I wake and have the entryways cleaned every day. 

Once a week, I just have to remember to pick up charger cords from near floor outlets or Roomba wraps them up and the dogs water dish (I haven’t got virtual boundaries measured properly),  and shoes etc to make it easier. It mostly navigates all the furniture and crannies. 

One suggestion for app: instead of area and lifetime stats, set it up to cue for maintenance — when to check rollers, rear wheel, clean/check filter, etc. even a reset stats button would help (I check rollers and hit reset). Otherwise I probably won’t check anything until it’s smoking. :-)

title: Sign up for the betas!!!!!
text:
The new features in the betas are awesome. As of today the beta can now detect carpeting. FINALLY.  so you can set it to have more power in theses areas.   

Also recently released feature that for awhile was in the betas has been through careful drive option.  Once the areas are mapped, setting it on keeps it from bumping into most walls. It now stays about 1-2 inches away from everything. It's great to have it follows wall and than have it seemlessly move around couches and stuff. No more bumping, backing up, turning, and than going around. In1 single motion it just casually swerves while still staying an inch or two away.  It vacuums way faster that way.

title: Not bad, but still room for improvement
text:
Overall this app is pretty good, but there’s definitely room for improvement. 

First of all: stop making the app completely dependent on AWS! There is no legitimate reason for this app to be “always online”, it should be able to communicate with the Roomba via an ad-hoc connection or at least WLAN. 

Secondly, there’s a minor yet annoying bug that causes the app to show that it’s not connected with the Roomba (despite being able to show battery level…) until you force close and reopen the app. 
Either improve the communication logic or give the user a refresh button so they don’t have to force close the app. 

Lastly this is a companion app to a premium product, especially when using the app for a high end model. As such it’s simply lazy this day and age to not include options to control the Roomba via Siri/Shortcuts. 
It’s trivial to hook into SiriKit and Intents so users can use Siri and/or the Shortcuts app to control the Roomba. 

Instead iRobot chose to go the extremely lazy route by hooking into IFTTT with basic and calling it a day.

Budget conscious competitor Neato even offers Shortcuts to use, you’d think the premium brand can as well.

title: Love my robotic vacuum
text: Having two huskies in my house means a lot of husky fur-balls everywhere. This vacuum is way better than the previous model which was the 600 series. It’s a lot smarter and knows where it needs to avoid if possible. With loving this product/brand I decided to purchase the cousin version which is the iRobot Braava jet mop. I would have to give this device a 4 star because it’s something that is new on the market and the engineers still have some bugs that need to resolved. It’s like the mop gets confused and goes in circles over and over to the point I have to go stop it,pick it up and move it somewhere else. Overall, I am very satisfied with the equipment

title: Love this vacuum
text:
This is my second Roomba. i6 is much quieter than it’s predecessor! I love that it always finishes the job now that it empties itself when full! I does a wonderful job keeping dust and pet hair and dander under control. 
The two reasons I did not give it 5 stars: I’ve had to reboot it for “hardware problem” twice in the first four weeks of having it, and I cannot seem to get it to clean one of my rooms fully. It has mapped my bedroom fully one time, but has not cleaned the entire area since. I even tried starting it in that room but it doesn’t get the entire area even after I’ve made sure there are no obstructions other than furniture in it’s way. I do love this vacuum though!! I cannot imagine NOT having one!

title: Better than expected
text:
My husband ask for iRobot roomba for Christmas. He has everything and grown kids happy to have an idea. He has a large Rottweiler that lives with him in his man cave. He has to vacuum rest of house ( over 3000 sq ft) once a week because of all the black dog hair. It’s been an ongoing problem since he brought the dog home. 
He decided this roomba was his answer. 
He had raved about it since he got it, decided I needed one for the rest of the house(knowing it might quiet me about the dog hair), I thought he was just trying to get out of vacuuming. 
He went to Costco brought me my own.  I have furniture everywhere.  Plants, throw rugs, I really didn’t think this would work for me.  I have got to say, I am shocked at how well this thing works! She goes around everything! I am loving her! 
I have scheduled her to vacuum 3x a week. 
She even goes back to her base to empty her bin! 
I still get out my old vacuum to do behind doors and closets, but this girl goes under tables, beds, she is very thorough.  If you are on the fence, don’t be. I’m extremely happy with my purchase. My husband is too!

title: Third Roomba review.
text:
I have been increasingly DISAPPOINTED and DISSATISFIED with the Roomba’s overall performance. This is my third Roomba. It used to be that the interfaces were simple AND predictable. The vacuum did its job of vacuuming. The app interface is slow and incredibly glitchy. In an effort for ‘connectivity’ {or data collection} the company has lost sight of the most important question... DOES IT DO ITS JOB WELL AS A VACUUM CLEANER? How can we improve its performance as a VACUUM CLEANER? I can say whole heartedly that it’s performance as a vacuum cleaner has gone for by 50-75%. I use it daily and am ready to no longer be a loyal customer. I am very saddened by this unfortunate shift and forgetting of the objects original purpose and use and continued question of performance. 

On a side note... something at a price point of $1000 {our price for our last model} only being engineered to last for 2-3 years... I am shaking my head at the absurdity of that in general.

title: Love this Thing!! Wish I could add room(s) while it’s cleaning though
text:
My butler-robot, “Jarvis” (AKA J-dawg) is awesome - he cleans my floors like a freakin’ champ! And I LOVE the feature where you can clean individual, separate rooms too! The recent add of letting you pick the order of which room to clean was awesome, but sometimes I start a clean job on 1 room and then realize later that I want to add a room (or 2) to clean after the current clean job, but the only way to do that is to stop the job, send J-dawg to the home base, and then add both the jobs. 

On a longer term thought, it would be awesome if Jarvis 2.0 could climb stairs, or even connect with some sort of a “smart door” that opens and closes doors.

title: Latest app update is terrible!!
text: I recently purchased the I 7+ and it was working great early January and then Roomba updated the app and now I’m having all sorts of trouble. The I 7+ will die in the middle of a cleaning cycle, failing to make it back to home base to charge. Isn’t the robot supposed to go home when it’s battery reaches a certain percentage? And speaking of percentages, why was it removed? Were people complaining too much about terrible battery life ? so they decided to remove the icon so people couldn’t see it? Also the smart maps no longer work and after each cleaning cycle it is currently not generating a map of the area cleaned anymore. I’m hoping they update this soon, otherwise I’m going to return this product back before my return window ends. I purchased top-of-the-line model thinking it would be great to take  advantage of all the smart features, but with the latest app update this rumba is no better than a $300 version.

title: Great little helper
text: My iRobot- Irene was a welcomed birthday gift. It is fun watching her run around my home. She does well getting pretty much everywhere. I would have given 5stars but my only negatives about her is how she crashes into some things in her path because for some reason she doesn’t sense them before hand. I am not sure what her range is as far as where the sensors are but if it isn’t a wide object like a coach or cabinet she doesn’t know it’s there until she crashes into it, and she hits things hard. I’m worried she make damage herself. It’s only been a few days and she already has scratches of paint and a couple that scratched off the paint! She looks more beat up than my vacuum I’ve had for 3 years. That’s my only concern.

title: Updated Rating
text: I am downgrading my review from three to one star. The most important features of this app to me do not work with the s9+. I have reset the vac twice, which means I have had to go through the mapping process three times now, and set all my schedules up each time. I wanted to set up a whole house cleaning, with the rooms done in the order I wanted, but every time I try to save the schedule, it removes the order I set and reverts to vacuum all. I tried removing one room, and it will save the settings, but the vacuum does not follow the order set. Not only that, but the last time it ran, it only did half the rooms, stopped to recharge and never finished. I will not reset again. That does not help. Nor does re-doing the schedules. It makes no sense that you cannot save maps and schedules, and reload them after either a reset, or purchase of a new robot. This app is all but useless for my needs.

title: Owner of 2 iRobot Vacuums and 1 Wet Mop
text:
Wet Mop does a decent job (won’t completely remove a stubborn/sticky mess like spilled juice/soda that your kids left behind and didn’t tell you before it dried, although it does make the manual effort required afterwards easier).  Also, cleaning fluid and pads get expensive. Have had the Wet Mop for almost two years and have probably spent enough money on fluid/pads to by another Wet Mop. 

However, if you do your research, you know that going in. 

Floor mapping works great. If you invest the time in the beginning configuring the room areas to clean and keep out zones by dragging lines on the 2D map, the vacuum and mop will work in tandem via WiFi.  Vacuum goes first and mop follows behind. One click from your phone. Great feature!!

title: I love my Roomba but...
text: My i8 (Costco) robot keeps going into a Keep Out zone which is under the oven in the kitchen. I have tried widening the zone but then that encroaches on an area in the kitchen I do want it to clean. Sometimes it doesn’t go in the keep out zone. Other times it does. Also the app reports a lost connection to the robot fairly often. Today it took the long way home when trying to find the dock. It was within four feet of the dock but circled back through the other side of a room that wasn’t on the cleaning schedule to get to it. It also frequently turns side to side out sounds around as if it can’t figure out which way to go. It has occasionally not finished its schedule but reported that it is finished. This all seems to have started within the last few weeks. Prior to that it was working well.

title: Roomba could not complete job
text:
We have had the i7+ for over a year. Something has gone horribly wrong in the past few months with their app. Until then, the Roomba always functioned perfectly. But with the release of the new mapping/scheduling update that allowed you to name areas to clean, it’s been a disaster. 

The robot frequently gets lost and runs out of battery. It will sometimes die within one foot of the dock (about 2-3x/week). More often, it disobeys the schedule and cleans in the order of wants. And almost every day it now can’t breach the invisible barriers between rooms in our open-concept home...  there are no walls and no doors and yet it can’t get through. It says it’s fine after cleaning one room. And at least daily it claims “path blocked” when there is nothing there and the light is left on. 

It’s a shame. It used to be amazing. Now it’s basically useless.

title: Great product, not the best App
text: The iRobot vacuum cleaner works really good!  I have a large dog and was worried that it couldn’t handle the large amount of shedding or I would have to change the dump bags often, but this wasn’t the case.  The main reason for complaining is the App is always needing updates!  You can no longer use the app at all until it updates!  I find no reason to force updates every week or 2 weeks just to use the app!  Even my Bank app allows me to continue without updating, allowing me to find a more convenient time to perform updates...  another feature of the app that would be nice is to take the map it creates of your home while vacuuming and split into zones, allowing cleaning different areas more often or at different times.

title: The app needs to be improved.
text:
Robot used to have a button on its application where I could force it to self evacuate. That application has been removed and the robot does not self evacuate. It takes forever with the people that answered the support line to go through all the procedures that they want to go through before they help you make it self evacuate. There really should be an instruction place on the app that tells you how to reset the robot, there should be the self-evaluation button replaced.

Before they remove the spot and I had purchased six of these robots and was extremely happy with them. Somebody has apparently repaired a problem that did not exist and it still doing created one for me. I will not buy anymore until that button is replaced.

title: Love Everything about having an automatic Vacuum!
text:
I did not think I needed a robot vacuum, my son got it for me for Christmas and I thought it was so thoughtful. He noticed I was struggling to push the vacuum and having a dog that sheds we needed the vacuum run more often than I was doing it. We all thought the dog was going to be scared of it. The dog was curious the first time and barked a little bit but then realized it could not jump up on the couch and she was safe up there. Now I sent my Google or Alexa and tell it to run just as we are leaving for a walk. 
By the time I get home my carpet is clean and the next day I do the floors. This every other day switching is the best!

title: Has a few issues but happy overall
text:
The app is easy to use and simple but is inconsistent with push notifications. I will often return home with roomba stuck or the bin will fill while I am home but I won’t receive a notification. Aside from that, the app functions very well and has some nice, convenient features.  

-SIDE NOTE (if app developers even read these things)
I do wish that you could more refine roomba’s path. For instance, I live shotgun home in the south (long and narrow) and roomba’s base station is set up on a parallel wall. Because roomba’s path has it make sweeps perpendicular to its base station orientation, it makes 50+ passes working its way down hallways instead of just making 3 or 4 going up or down the hallway. 
The easy solution would be to put the base station on a perpendicular wall so it would leave its base, turn 180 degrees, and do long paths up and down the house. Unfortunately, I do not have a spot for the base station on a perpendicular wall, so it would be nice to have a setting to change roomba’s sweep pattern orientation. 
It’s an issue that 99% of people probably wouldn’t even notice, but it would be a nice feature to add. 
Thanks iRobot!

title: Great Functionality w/ 980
text:
Haven’t had any issues with the app. I do have a wishlist of additional features I would like. 

1) Ability to edit the vacuum performance and cleaning passes on the weekly schedule. Instead of just blanket settings for number of cleaning passes and vacuum boost, I would like to be able to make certain days of the week “deep clean days” to have multiple passes and vacuum boost, while others are just quick single pass on eco mode.

2) Using saved home maps from previous cleaning: be able to designate certain rooms based on that and ask Roomba to just go clean a certain room. I know I can just pick Roomba up and stick it in there and hit clean,  but then I have to lock it in so it doesn’t escape and clean the hallway.

title: May not be best but works good so far
text: App is ok. It gives the option to create an order for separate rooms but honestly it doesn’t recognize where it is going and just cleans wherever it finds space. So pretty much every new job or favorite created is same for Roomba. No difference if it says kitchen etc. Developer probably can program it the way that once you create a Roomba favorite and run it in a room, it remember/attach that room map with the favorite and next time if I use the same favorite order it clean the same area. That saves the headache of putting virtual walls and self created walls. Overall cleaning power is great and I like the work it does including deep cleaning. Saves time. Pleased with service.

title: Game-changer! As Long as It Doesn’t Get Stuck.
text:
We have 2 long haired cats and a long-haired dog.  LOTS of hair.  Lotta dust, too.  Running the Roomba once a day has massively reduced the fur and dust in my house.  Roomba only vacuums hard wood and low-pile rugs here, FYI. I still vacuum the rugs every so often for deeper cleaning, but the amount of hair and dust I empty out of the Roomba is impressive!  

I did have to do a little troubleshooting to get her to work reliably.  One couch was a height that allowed her to go under but she’d get stuck sometimes.  Putting moving sliders under the sofa feet raised it just enough to keep her from getting stuck.  

It’s not quick.  Takes two batter charges to do my main floor, but I’m not bothered by that.  Just something to plan around.

title: Pet hair issues
text: So, we bought out S9 at Christmastime on sale. Hadn’t really intended to but thought it might help to make our lives easier. Well, it has and it hasn’t. Unfortunately, have a Jack Russell with the smooth coat who sheds year round, means there is always a coating white terries hair all over our rug and since the S9 only vacuums in one direction, it means that coating is still there when our S9 is done. It is very frustrating. What the program needs, it the ability to train the S9 to concentrate on a particular spot and or to approach the carpets from different angles. Like one route in one direction and the other perpendicular to it. Or maybe an area rug specific setting.  Overall, our S9 does well in other parts of the house with hard surface floors. So, overall, he is alright!

title: New updated app terrible customer service lot words no action
text: I am completed frustrated with my i7 newer updates keep getting worse. Doesn't complete jobs, wears down battery going in circles. They recalled self empty base,  new one  wont self empty. Talked to , sent detailed emails to customer support and  gotten no place . They respond but no actions taken, listening not  actually doing anything. Had rob remap, relocate, reset multiple times tired of time wasted . Next time buying another brand . Loved  it at first no more not year old yet. I have screen shots all robot canceled jobs goes to base to charge and never completes. Everytime I speak to support they blame software , not hardware, and want me to trouble shoot and reset . Really frustrated. Found multiple similar complaints online . Robot great at first but last few months of updates making it behave poorly.  Is it bad machine or bad software?

title: No notifications
text:
On iOS, I get absolutely no notifications. I’ve only had it for a couple of days.  The first time it cleaned, the robot’s battery died mid-cleaning and didn’t re-dock before hand and I didn’t get a notification. Both times it cleaned, the bin was full after it finished, but the app didn’t tell me either time. I’ve never received a notification from the app, where I feel I should have at least gotten three at this point. All my notifications are enabled, both on the app and in iOS settings, but nothing. 

The vacuum is totally awesome though. The only quirky problem I have is that one of my doors doesn’t stay fully open, so the robot shuts itself in my master bedroom by banging on the door repeatedly until it closes. I don’t fault the product for that though. I need to fix my door.

title: Random wandering
text:
This little thing really cleans the floors good, it seem random as to where it goes, it wonders around the house in what seems to be a random pattern, cleaning the same areas over and over again and because of that it needs to recharge once to finish a complete cleaning and our house is only 1200sqft. It’s kind of loud, forget watching tv with this cleaning. I am impressed with how well it cleans, one time it picked up a 3” golf tee and dog food on the floor isn’t a problem for this either. Just be sure you don’t have any cords, shoe laces or anything like that around for it to pick up. 
Overall it is great to have around, I wish it was a little quitter and that the battery life was longer.

title: App redesign took a good interface to mediocre
text: A some months back, iRobot majorly redesigned this app. Before that, it was intuitive to add a map for a separate floor or change how things were programmed. But the update has made it harder to figure out how to create additional maps. And even when you make the right decisions, you sometimes still don’t get what you came for. IRobot needs to employ some human interface designers. I’m a software engineer and this new UI is not great. Update: despite iRobot’s responses to my review and many others, telling us we will all get used to it, they actually did fix a few things and make some improvements. The UI is only marginally better now, but the bug fixes are solid and the avoid zones are a great feature addition.

title: Good vacuum!
text: This vacuum does a great job getting under furniture and covering my small condo on a single charge. I keep my floor fairly clean so use to just pick up the accumulated stuff that I carry in from outside on my feet, etc. I’ve had it a couple of months now and haven’t had to empty the bag yet. If I leave it unplugged too long then it seems to go into some low mode and has issues until I fully charge it and then power cycle it again it seems like but after a few full charges it returns to normal. The vacuum is fairly quiet but the base when sucking up the vacuum contents sounds like a small jet engine! Very happy with it so far.

title: Overall good but no sound notifications!
text: I like the app, but I've never been able to get audible notifications for when it is stuck, or there's an error, so that I never know there's a problem until I literally open up my phone and see the banner notification. Yes, everything is turned on appropriately in the phone in the notifications, I know how to do that, but although sounds are turned on, they do not work. A little research online showed me that I am not the only person with this problem. This means that I can't really use it if I'm not home, or even in a different part of the house, because I have no way of knowing if it has run into a problem and stopped his job, without continually checking on it.

title: Workhorse
text:
So we get a lot of dust in our home. We have a Golden Retriever, chickens, goats and 4 small children. Our Roomba gets put to the test every time it goes to vacuum our floor. We are constantly impressed with how well it does. It picks up all of the dirt and moves seamlessly through the hardwood, area carpet and tile in the kitchen. 

It can take upward of an 1 hr and 30 min to clean our downstairs area - but it gets it done, dog hair and all. If I could make one improvement, it would be the amount of maintenance I have to do in it. At least 2 times per week, I have to clean the Roomba out manually, including getting tangled dog hair out of the roller. I know we work it hard, but if there is a way to improve that, It would be perfect.

title: Cannot edit home map in app
text: I don’t have a problem controlling my Roomba i7+ with the app, setting up a schedule or anything like that... BUT Ever since the newest/biggest app updates have rolled out (when the Home Screen changed), I have not been able to edit my home’s map in the app. Anytime I try to add or delete a room divider, the app freezes and crashes. I did not have this problem when I first got my Roomba and installed the app back in August 2020.  It is very frustrating and I have no idea what to do about it. I really don’t want to have to reset and start over with training runs. I honestly don’t think that will fix the app freezing up and I’m afraid I won’t be able to set up any rooms with how often the app crashes on my iPhone 8 and my husbands iPhone 10. Please help or come up with a bug fix ASAP.

title: What I have experienced
text: I own both the vacuum and the wet jet cleaner. The first several months they worked fantastic. The vacuum would do gentle bumps into my furniture. Now it is more dramatic and harder bumps. Another issue has developed over time, I have tile trough out the entire downstair. When I first started using the  I Robot wet jet I was extremely happy, my floors were always beautiful. Now it constantly gets caught in the grouting lines. Both units have docking and charging problems.  I have maintained both units very well. I purchase the new brushes and pads, cleaning solution and filters. My I Robot vacuum and the wet jet just are not operating correctly.  I certainly was expecting them to last longer than a year.

title: Cleaning behaviors and settings by scheduled job
text: You removed the ability to associate cleaning behavior or settings by the scheduled job or a favorite.  Vacuum intensity reverts and must be set manually before each and very scheduled job.  That means I have to change the setting before the job runs.  Which defeats the whole purpose of scheduling in the first place.   I should be able to run a favorite job or scheduled job and have the settings I choose tied to that job.  Now I’d have to set a reminder to change settings before the job runs.  It makes absolutely no sense.  This is going in the wrong direction.  Regardless of mop or vac I want the settings to be remembered when that job runs each time.  I feel this last app upgrade missed the mark.  This is not easier to use when you have to remember to make changes ahead of something automatically that runs for you.

title: age 64
text: This is my 3rd Romba vacuum cleaner and I love it. Over the years I’ve had several dogs and at the moment I have a total of five abandon dogs and that I run my rumba every single day in my house on my white carpet and even though it’s 20 years old my carpet is it still looks fairly good and it’s clean. I have a bad back and a lot of joint pain so without this rumba I’m sure my house would be a real bad mess so I appreciate the fact that I have it and I also have a regular vacuum cleaner that I use but my room but I use every single day and I can’t believe it what it picks up but like I said I do have five dogs wouldn’t be without it anymore.

title: Best thing ever
text:
We have had a Electrolux Trilobite since they first came out about 20 years ago. It wandered aimlessly about for about 15 minutes, switched to battery number two, ran for another 15 minutes, and then could not find its way home. 
Imagine my shock when our new Roomba ran a perfect pattern, mapped our entire 2400 foot one level house, and found his way home EVERY time. Then he parked on the charging station and DUMPED HIS DIRT without my involvement. 
It has now been 21 days into our love affair and his first bag of dirt is finally full. 
This is an amazing piece of engineering. I only hope I can say the same thing a year from now.

title: Slightly Discouraged
text: I love my vacuum and I wouldn’t trade it for anything. I didn’t have a single problem with anything except an occasional app to machine connection problem which I know has to do with our WiFi connection not the iRobot. Then I received the new home base because mine was recalled for water issues. The base has never worked right since I received it. I have tampered with it and finally got fed up and sent in a report to iRobot whom I have yet to receive a response from. So I am slightly discouraged about the elongated delay in getting back to me on fixing this issue. But overall I highly recommend this product with the self emptying feature. It is worth every penny.

title: Version 5 takes two steps back
text:
I’ve been living with version five for about a week now, and I really don’t like it. Instead of having separate screens for different functions that are easily accessible by icons at the bottom of the screen, everything has been jammed into one long, scrolling screen.

It’s especially annoying that the top third of the first screen is occupied by a totally useless Roomba animation, while the useful big green button for stopping and pausing is completely gone. Now I have to locate a skinny little gray bar. 

Apparently this change was driven by the desire to include the new “Favorites“ section on the first screen. That is totally useless for me, however, as I have a non-mapping model. Yes, I know that it offers me the ability to create shorter routines, but what’s the point in that?

All in all, whoever designed version 5 created a highly-cluttered interface that’s also significantly less convenient than the old version. It’s as if the UI has been designed by somebody who did webpage design 15 or 20 years ago, and who isn’t aware about all of the lessons that have been learned since then.

title: Robbie
text: I’ve named him Robbie. He’s a very awesome little guy and actually adorable to watch him work. I love that I can actually mark areas in the map on my phone app where I don’t want him to go. For example, Behind the sofa or in a room with a cat litter box. I can choose any particular area or room to clean. He evacuates himself and charges on the dock. Pretty much Worth the price tag. It’s a hefty one too for the top of the line at the time. I’ve seen others with lower price tags but I tend to trust the original. Very helpful with cats leaving their fur all over and tracking litter into the hall. We have an open floor plan so fur is everywhere and Robbie gets it all. 😊

title: Net positive, some learning curve
text:
Generally, safer than hiring house cleaners and better at getting under furniture where so much dust and cat hair live than any human. Can’t be beat.
Downside: camera model like ours gets confused in the dark, so either you leave the lights on or run only during daylight hours. No biggie but surprising.
Robot runs out of battery power in our roughly 2100 sq ft house without retreating to its base station although sometimes it does. The messages from robot are usually pretty clear when robot gets defeated by clutter in the house and is a good motivator for less clutter
House is generally much , much cleaner and easier to manage than any cleaning service. I recommend this to everyone.

title: Roomba i8
text: My Roomba does a very nice job with my multiple rooms of combination bare floors and area rugs.  I thought I would have to pick up my six foot runners but Roomba manages to do an excellent job on them also. The only reason my Roomba did not get a Five Star review was his aggressive behavior during mapping when he would get stuck , instead of asking for help, he would use his power to release himself. Nice job except I ended up with a few new scratches on my flooring. I guess I needed to keep a better eye on this newborn during the mapping process.   Since the mapping has been completed I have not noticed any further areas where Roomba gets stuck.  Enjoying the extra freedom of not having to run a sweeper.

title: Works great still - after 4 years in service!
text:
My older iRobot was moved (replaced by a new i8 iRobot) from the upstairs rooms to the lower level it has continued working fine - even on the older style deep pile carpet in the family room.  Only work done on the 980 model so far in the 4 years is to complete routine replacement of the filter, rubber wheels and spinner brush as they get old.  Note - recent error messages may require replacement of the dust bin at some point in the future - need to wait and see about timing for this item. 
All in all - I am fully satisfied with the life and performance of the old 980 vacuum over these years 👍!

title: Almost completely useless
text:
I had to disable notifications for this app to get it to stop advertising at me, and now I don’t know when the Roomba gets stuck or needs to be emptied to continue. I have not successfully cleaned an area larger than one room in months because of this god awful app. 

It’s also unbelievably slow. In the old app I could just open it and start the Roomba, or at least walk over and push a button. Took maybe one minute. With this app and the latest Roomba it takes 5-10 minutes for everything to wake up and let me start a cleaning job. 

I used to tell all of my friends about how amazing the Roomba is whenever we talked about how bad modern smart devices are. “The only good one is the Roomba. Highly recommend!” Now I warn them off of your functionally worthless pile of junk just because of how bad this app is. Congratulations.

title: New App Design is Horrible
text:
UI nightmare!  Previous version was simple and easy to navigate. You could easily start/stop Roomba with a big button in the center. Or view schedule, go to history, etc. with a quick tap on bottom icons. But new version puts the controls all over the screen or makes you scroll to find them. And it's busy with stuff I don't want or need. Why is there a big empty section for notifications when there are no notifications? Revert to more user friendly UI please.

Also, when viewing details of a run (in History" the date & time and back button arrow at the top are written in white against a near-white background, making it almost impossible to see. If I were completely new to the app, I wouldn't know how to go back to the previous screen.

title: A big help around the house for daily cleanup.
text: My iRobot which I named Bella, is a wonderful little helper around the house for daily cleaning especially on hardwood floors. She does miss some dirt and leaves remnants of cat hair on carpets sometimes. But for day-to-day use it certainly does help clean up crumbs, cat hair and dirt. She doesn’t like thick carpeting so I avoid her going into areas where I have shag rugs. If I want deep cleaning of rugs in corners and areas that she misses I will use my standard vacuum. It’s nice that my iRobot can go under bedding and in areas where it may be difficult for me to get to. Sometimes she gets caught up in area rugs and has difficulty getting her self out of predicament so I have to help her sometimes.

title: Roomba is the best!
text:
I have been using iRobot Roomba for a few years now and continue to be impressed by the product, app and service. Generally after a year or so, products no longer receive support and they want you to purchase a new product. Not iRobot, I still purchase new brushes, filters etc and still get new upgrades in software and its great!!

I have purchased major appliances and wish they where half as good as what i have received from iRobot.

The new app, has a cleaner look and they have upgraded the Roomba cleaning options, still discovering new features, great so far…many thanks for your dedication.

title: Such a help!
text: I am so glad that we purchased our little robot helper and wish we would have done it sooner! With two dogs and two cats, along with a very active husband, there tends to be a lot of dirt and fur that makes its way around our house. While the robot does not get into every nook and cranny, such as tracks of s sliding glass door, it maintains the floors around the house beautifully! It saves me so much time in vacuuming or sweeping, and can get into places that I normally couldn’t with a regular vacuum without moving furniture constantly (under the bed, behind couches, etc.). I really can’t speaking enough praise about our Roomba!

title: Roomba I7
text:
I’ve had this vacuum for a couple of years now, and I’m simply amazed at how effective this little system is.
We have 3 GSDs (German shedders) and this vacuum manages 90+% of the hair - and that’s a LOT of hair!  I deep vacuum weekly, moving furniture, and cannot emphasize how much this system helps me keep things manageable and clean.
Maintenance is quick and easy, replacement parts are affordable, and it’s very reliable.
The vacuum itself is much stronger and robust than expected, it can navigate over and around any surface in my home without issue.
Without question this is the single best purchase I’ve made in a decade - well...it may be tied with my new BBQ pit.

title: Good but not Great
text:
Roomba i4 does a good job vacuuming, but occasionally needs assistance.  The robot unit is well designed & functional, but needs the bin emptied after every full floor run.  The app nicely provides a map of the area vacuumed, but I cannot find where that can be zoned for smaller / room specific jobs.

One BIG issue is the unit became stuck @ base, claiming it was vacuuming, but not.  App did not provide diagnostics or meaningful help.  A web search turned up a full reboot sequence that got it operational again.

Lastly, be prepared to clean underbody elements about every 4 jobs, as the get hair wound into them that needs removal for optimal performance.  The design makes this easy to do, but the frequency was not expected.

title: Ver 5.0.1 user interface is Terrible
text:
This 1 star review is for the latest update. The previous version was a 5 Star app but someone decided it needed to have a fresh look and royally screwed it up. 
The original iRobot app was wonderful. It was simple to use and did exactly what you needed to do. This new version 5.0.1 looks like it was designed by someone that thinks they know what the end-user wants but has no clue. 
Us blue-collar workers want a app that you can press a button that says “clean” and the I robot goes and does the job. Oh... the previous version did, but you killed it. We don’t give a darn about extra frills. 
You know, the lame idea of “keeping things fresh” which is a website and app designer’s buzz word always has negative affects on the end user. Designers should learn that the original “keep it simple” mentality is always the best way to go?

title: This app doesn’t work
text: I’ve only had my Roomba i8+ for a few days. I’m trying to set up smart maps on the app so I can create rooms for the Roomba to clean. Every single time I try to delete a room divider that the Roomba created and create my own room dividers, the app freezes and I can’t do anything! It eventually takes me back to my Home Screen on my iPhone. I eventually maybe be able to create one or two new room dividers, but then it freezes again. I just got off the phone with customer service at Roomba and the tech said that people have complained about this happening with the app. He said the only thing to do is delete the app and start over. Seriously! If you’re a constantly deleting the app and starting over how are you ever going to be able to create numerous “rooms” to tell the vacuum where you want it to clean?

title: Long Day
text: Sunday, went to a  quick family gathering for dinner then home. Well we get home 6-7 hours later and all we want to do is relax. How SWEET it is!! The only reason you are reading this, yup i’m relaxing. We have people, dogs, cats, a house full. Now I”ll walk around barefoot on that floor when it’s done vacuuming and it feels so clean. You know the app is pretty cool maps out the area it vacuumed, shows progress and more. They have the laser beam wall things. Haha this now feels like work. In a nutshell 5 stars for quality of work, the app (I’ll check later to see progress) and finally with the time I saved it allowed me to do...

title: Watch app?
text:
Kinda wish I could control the direction it goes. There’s a grid thing in this new update I would have thought to do it but I haven’t figured it out if it does. My irritation is that I can hear the robot roll over an air vent 3 separate times (like it will go to another area of the house between) and it never makes it to the room I want it to. I keep having to physically move it to get the area. So I wish I could like do a redirect in the app or something. But then I guess I should just vacuum with a handheld if I paid attention to the robot all the time? 
Also, a simple Apple Watch app would be nice. Get the notification it is stuck, or be able to start and stop/ send home. Those simple features would be great.

title: Beware of latest update
text: Have loved this robot and app until the latest update from the  past few weeks... now have had to do complete factory reset and remapping of my home.  Getting an error that says that my Alfred is registered on multiple accounts.  I have spoken with customer service 3 times in the past two weeks. Promised a call back, never received it.   Can barely comprehend half of the people I spoke to. Spent 59 minutes on the phone this last time.  They cannot find that my robot is or has ever been registered to anyone else.  They apologized but aren’t really sure why I am having the issue except there is an issue with the latest update that will unfortunately affect some of the customers in this way.  Their fix - delete everything and resend the robot on 3-6 training runs per floor of my 3 story home. Spectacular...

title: Iboto
text:
I had an older Roomba that did a great job but the way my house is configured the unit had a hard time finding “home”. This new unit does the entire house and during the cleaning process when the battery gets low it docks itself, recharges and continues where it left off. 
You can literally set, cancel, or change the time you want the unit to start (and if necessary, you can stop the unit remotely with your phone app.).
 It does a great job. I use it everyday and I am amazed how much cat hair and dirt Roomba collects every time.
 Since I’ve begun using this product (remember I had one before the 960) my carpets look much better and I feel confident they are much cleaner.
 I have eight cats that are in and out all day and sleep inside at night. I don’t know how I made it without my “Roomie”as I call it. 
The only two short comings I’ve found are when the iboto cloud is down you cannot operate it remotely and the floor needs to be free of cat toys. They will easily get stuck between the rollers and stop the machine. I plan to buy the kitchen floor cleaner/mop next.

title: Short lived warranty
text: These machines have a tendency to start having serious errors and defective issues right about the time the 6 month warranty expires. The trouble shooting on the app is not helpful, and from what I’ve found on online forums, many of the issues that develop with these machines ultimately result in a required total replacement (which is a very time consuming process of jumping through hoops. God forbid if you have a job or a life that doesn’t permit you 2 hours on the phone with a customer service tech). If you’re outside your warranty, good luck. Hope you have a lot of disposable income and free time. While these machines work great in the beginning, their longevity and support is unacceptably limited for how expensive they are.

title: Surprisingly bad app, missing features
text:
I’m surprised how poor this app is, with bad UI and missing no-brainer features.  It basically adds only two useful features, scheduling days of week and notification if vacuum gets stuck.  That’s it!  Two stars.  

Here’s what it won’t do.  There is no option to get notification before vacuum starts so you can pick up floor or close door, etc.   You can limit vacuum time, but only for single event, not scheduled cleanings.  What?  My room only needs 30 min but it runs until battery drains every time which is almost 2 hrs of annoying racket.  BTW, they confirmed the app won’t do this.  The list goes on and on. 

iRobot is clearly not even trying in the app dept.  It’s so bad it makes living with their vacuum products harder.  I won’t buy another.

title: RUMBA IS AWESOME
text:
My husband bought me the Rumba after a co-worker told him about one that he bought for his wife.  I was rather upset because I vacuum often. After Rumba scanned the rooms, which was fun to watch, I could not believe how good a job it did!   I can program it when I’m in town even!
My husband told his cousin about it and he went and got his wife one (recently).  They LOVE it!!!
We have a stand up fan that it gets caught on but, no big deal.  It will go recharge and finish the rest of the house.  It also does a better job of vacuuming than a regular vacuum cleaner!
It is a “Must have” for all. 
Makes housework so much easier!

title: Overall extremely satisfied.
text: The whole system works great. Connecting to Wi-Fi works good. The app is very intuitive. If I could give it 1/2 star less I would. Only reason being is sometimes it does leave little patches of dirt or hair behind. Other than that it works great! It has only got stuck twice. And that was early on in the process of learning my house. I have had it probably do over 100 cleanings. Once it maps out your house it is so neat to be able to just clean areas or certain rooms. I owned another robotic vacuum cleaner from a different manufacture. It does not compare to this.

title: I6 robot and app are phenomenal
text:
The I6 is incredible. It learned our main floor plan in about 5 hours (1400ish square feet) and can vacuum it all in 2 hours. Does way better than we do as humans vacuuming.

Since this review is for the app here is the app review: it’s a great app. It’s very user friendly and communicates perfectly with the roomba. It allows you to choose the order you vacuum rooms in, makes it easy to set up no go zones, targeted cleaning areas, and room dividers. It also does a good job communicating the needs of the roomba (bin full, stuck somewhere, battery low, etc.) I wouldn’t change a thing about this app, A+.

title: Multi-user household
text: So many apps require that you manage them so they don’t interfere with your life and sleep. This app actually assists in keeping my household flowing with no effort from me. By default, the app alerts are silent, thank god. Also, we have one i3 roomba with vac canister thingamajig and 3 of us have the app. It’s 2021 and our phones are getting old two iPhone 7s and a 6 (or maybe even a 5) and the app works perfectly on all. App walks you through connecting with the bot and it’s seamless. It’s a beautifully designed app. I’m really not sure how I managed without the Roomba before. Of course, I have two GSDs that shed enormous amounts.

title: True Love … BUT Let’s make it better
text:
I love my S9+ it keeps getting smarter , you gave really paid attention to making the intelligence much better . On my carpet I noticed the robot can leave lines circles triangles and squares you guys need to utilize this , You need to crate a BETA feature called “Finishing Touch” And give us a couple options on the way we want it to look at the end you could also interfrate graphic so the robot when it’s done cleaning the room finishing touches a logo or something to that degree .

Just think, a new feature called finishing touch that allows you to customize how it looks when it’s done, you’d be the and your S9 is very capable of doing as such :))

Just an idea, I tried to contact you with feedback on the app but there is no feedback options so I put it into this review

As far as the app is concerned, you e done amazing work, I love the smart mapping feature and clean zones and stay out zones , you’ve really made this experience top quality,

title: Buggy update
text: App no longer connects to roomba unless phone is connected to the same WiFi (used to conned fine before and I’ve checked all the settings multiple times). All the clean maps have vanished and new clean maps are not available, even after resetting roomba and running 3 small clean cycles. The “care” section of the app  no longer shows any status bars or anything. No longer receive notifications from the app (notifications are turned on in settings). The only feature which still seems to work is starting and stopping a cleaning cycle; however, this can only be accomplished when I am home and connected to my WiFi, which is pointless because I can just push the button on the roomba. Not sure what was updated on this version, but now everything I used to use the app for no longer works, essentially rendering it useless.

title: Great overall with quirks
text: Robot vacuuming is life-changing, but there are definitely areas of improvement. The UI would be better served by showing the map while the vacuum is active - showing what is clean and what is left to clean so that a user could rearrange the cleaning schedule or whatever (WFH life makes it more important to not have robots interrupt meetings). Also, it seems like the mapping has gotten worse lately - we’ve had our robot try to get to rooms by going through walls and then complaining that the path is blocked or come off the base, get confused, head back home and call it a day after a couple of minutes of spinning in circles.

title: Very smart
text:
This little robot is very smart, make sure you give it time to learn your house. We got the Brava in miss of moving in and some renovation  so there were quite a lot of obstacles at first. After a month I had removed the map and restarted it because the mop didn’t see the other side of the kitchen island. While renovating we have moved the island around. Once I restarted the mapping “Dot” figured out the entire 2000qrft in less than 2 hrs. Now we have the boundaries and clear zones set up. 
I just wish I could speak to the robot directly as Alexa doesn’t always translate well lol

title: Great improvement
text: I have had two earlier models of the iRobot Roombas. They were okay. This new model is awesome! If the Roomba can’t finish the job on one charge it goes back to the dock to recharge. When it has enough charge, it continues cleaning. The roomba remembers where it had to pause the cleaning and continues from that point instead of just making random cleaning patterns, or cleaning the same area twice. Both of the earlier models I had did random cleaning patterns. Both models  would often run out of charge before making it back to the dock, so you would have to hunt for where the roomba was stranded.

title: Back saver!
