text: My home isn’t very large but it is all tile. I have one that only does the master suite, the walk-in closet, bathroom and bedroom. I have to empty this one almost daily because I have a German Shepard and he sheds. I have a second one that does the rest of the house. This one is an upgrade from the one that does the master suite. It empties itself (it is very loud) but it makes my life easier. I have them both clean when I will be gone for the day. They require a small amount of maintenance beyond changing the filters. I clean the rollers and wheels once every couple of months. They clean under beds, tables, chairs any

title: Sooooo much better than.....
text: The one that we replaced. Yes. We loved Turbo (named lovingly for what he was trying to do, but he was very, VERY old). I just kept putting money, time and hope into the old guy but one day, he died. Enter our new model — Turbo Dos. He’s WiFi enabled, comes with a great app and responds immediately with the app whenever I want to start him up or return him home. The tray to clean out the dirt is designed really well and easy to clean. He’s great at mapping out where he needs to clean and does a great job. Definitely worth the money. Now if I could only afford to have one on all three floors.....

title: Love it!
text:
I hate doing housework and I’ve been looking at these iRobots for a while and thought they were a bit expensive, until I realized that they’re about the same price and a decent upright.

Anyway, I got the i3 and loved it. My mom always scoffed at them but when she saw mine work, she bought one the same day.

My mom LOVES hers. She’s thrilled that it gets under the the beds and does such great job on rugs. She said her kitchen rug has never been so clean. In addition, she has a cat and she was always complaining how much cat hair was in the house. Well, the i3 does an excellent job on cat hair, so that’s not an issue for her now.

title: Great Interface!
text: This company backs up solid hardware with an app interface that’s really easy to use. I was ready to spend a day setting up my Roomba and Brava, and was actually disappointed because it was so quick to do. My one complaint is that the way the two units can work with each other (the Brava can be made to mop right after the Roomba finishes) isn’t made very clear in the instructions. I had to look online to see how to do that. The upside is that the solution is so simple that it’s easy to overlook (there’s an option to do this while you’re scheduling a task on the Roomba).

title: Floors look great!
text:
We love our new Roomba. We originally bought the model 890, decided almost immediately to return it and buy the 960, which is what we own now. We wanted The additional feature of the mapping ability. So glad we made the choice to change. It’s absolutely awesome. Runs on a schedule. Figured out the layout of our home with no trouble and our floors look great!!!
August-2021…..thanks to IRobot, we were upgraded to the newer I7 with the auto empty system. We’ve had it about a month and so far it’s wonderful. Totally self operating and we haven’t had to touch it. 
Loving it!!!

title: Reluctant Buyer
text: I’ve been intrigued, but skeptical about the practicality of a Roomba for YEARS.  We have a big house with lots of objects to vacuum around. Initially, I was disappointed with my purchase.  The Roomba just really doesn’t do a thorough job on rugs, but when I learned to map and block off the rugs with the app, the time it’s saving me by vacuuming the rest of the house has really changed the way I do housework. Vacuuming the rugs with my Dyson takes me 11 minutes. Moving objects out of Roomba’s way takes another 4 minutes. Then I ask her to do the rest while I go do something else!  It’s amazing.

title: Review fir the i7 self Emptying
text: After having great success with my robot 980 I decided to purchase the rumba i7. The 980 worked flawlessly with the only exception having to empty the bin manually every time it ran. As far as the i7 claims went, it would empty itself. However, this is been a disaster. I robot has had to replace my i7At least once in the two years I have found it in the second one they sent me won’t even pick trash up. We have three Siberian huskies and the 980 has no problems collecting their hair. However the i7 gets it tangled in the brush roller and in the wheels and you have to manually clean it out every time it redocks. Sometimes it won’t even charge. This totally defeats the purpose of having it manually emptying it’s on bin. If you have to fool with it every time you don’t need to have it manually emptying the bin.

title: New App design is confusing
text:
I love the Roomba product! But this new app is terribly designed. Very hard to navigate and feels like the designers did a lot of "can we do this" thinking as opposed to "should we do this". Reminds me of the new Lifx App. Needlessly over complicated and adding features that no one will use. I.E. do you really want your Roomba to vacuum every time you leave your house? Absolutely not! Run to the grocery store real quick and you have to come home and deal with an in progress vacuum. 

Anyways, please stick to traditional, "boring" iOS design. No need to invent new navigation patterns for an app that should be dirt simple. No pun intended.

Update: My roombas are now not respecting their schedule. It is vacuuming on days that are not included in the set schedule. No idea what's going on.

title: Works where others simply can’t!
text:
Having lived with a competitive robot for the last five years, we’d gotten used to moving furniture all around every time we cleaned, and doing the cleaning in multiple sessions to avoid “robot confusion.”  That’s all gone now with our new Roomba!  We simply set up a boundary marker, close one door (a closet with too much “stuff”), and let her go!  Rhonda Roomba does her cleaning cycle of approx 1800 square feet in around 2hrs, goes back to her base when she’s finished, and reports status on the iRobot app!  It all simply WORKS, which is all one can hope for from any household assistant. My wife is constantly amazed at how much dust Rhonda can find each time she completes her cleaning chores!

Nicely done!

title: Roomba 960
text:
We are a family of five plus a rough collie.   We have had a series 560 for a few years and just upgraded to a 960 a few weeks ago.   We are sooo happy we did!   The technology has improved so much and it does a fantastic job!   Even with a long long haired dog and three kids the roomba surpasses my expectations!  

Being able to control it from my iPhone is a plus.  It even shows me where it cleaned on a map and it always gets each room, one by one before it heads to the next room.   When it needs to be recharged it does and then immediately heads back to where it left off.   

Our family loves our roomba!

title: Helpful suggestion
text: I would like to be able to use this app to set the IRobot underneath my king-size bed. I should be able to use the app to hit spot clean because everybody knows how nasty underneath the bed gets. And then I should be able to from the application hit spot clean three or four more times until I am happy with the way the floor looks under the bed. By the way it’s set up now is the only way I can do it is have it go into clean mode and do the whole room ignoring most of underneath the bed because of the way my bed has legs it bounces around under there constantly

title: Great product
text:
Does a great job cleaning the house. Gives you a summary upon completion and seems to get more efficient as time goes on. It has gotten stuck a few times but only because of the layered carpet we have in the house, not because it gets ‘lost.’

I would like to recommend that you be able to have the option to change the suction level from room to room. It does a great job switching to performance mode on carpets but we have cats in a hardwood floor room. It has a hard time picking up the litter off the floor on the eco setting so I’d love to be able to have it go to performance mode in that room only.

title: Satisfied owner
text:
I’ve gotten a lot of good work out of my Roombie. Generally works very well. Much better and more fun than the older versions I had that were random (didn’t map) and didn’t empty in the base. Also much easier to clean than models with real brushes. 
Some things I would like to see in the app:
A cancel button to cancel a job. 
Better status indicators especially when the job pauses. For instance when it stops is it because of battery, full bin, stuck or other problems, trying to find home or combinations of these?
It sometimes can’t map when I move it upstairs (just shows a rectangle). This is my 3rd Roomba vac.

title: App update killed it
text:
I7 model roomba. Used to be great no problems at all. They updated the app and it’s practically worthless. Doesn’t run at its scheduled time, won’t empty the bin on its own, stops to recharge and doesn’t finish its job, communication problems with the base all the time and worst part for me is the elimination of the empty bin option that was always there

Been trying to call costumer service but you just wait on hold for an hour plus. Tried emailing about the issue to. All I get is a cookie cutter reply message saying to contact customer service. So on top of the problem with it not emptying itself they have terrible customer service (which I’ve seen as a complaint about roomba). Still no resolution to the problem. Also no answer in the faqs section of their website about this problem

title: Robot is awesome but…
text: The vacuum itself is pretty great, but the app is missing some functionality and control, and the base station doesn’t fully empty the rumba. The app should let you make more detailed edits to the map like changing the room size or shape and indicate where doorways and ledges are present. I also wish it would let me control the rumba to steer it on a specific course and learn that route. (Like a route learning or pilot mode.) I’ve got two small ledges between doorways and the rumba must go over them in a specific way to avoid being stuck. It should also let you make other shapes for zones (not just square/rectangle).

title: Problems since update (Updated)
text:
12/03: In fairness to iRobot, the issues were not really with the update but instead cloud based services. The timing was coincidental with when I upgraded to the latest version of the app. I have therefore returned my rating to a 4. The app works fine, though I do think the user interface could use some work. There is no denying overall the robot vacuum makes life a bit easier. 

Original: Worked great until recent update. Now constantly says phone is not attached to the network, when it clearly is. Alerts not coming through. Etc. App is running on an iPhone 12 Pro.

title: Gotten really bad
text: I live in a one story home that is 4000sq ft.  It is very spread out and I own both the s9+ and the Braava Jet mop.  Suddenly large chunks of the map are missing and the mop just can’t find anything.  That’s probably because after over a year of using a map, it decided to add a random hallway.  Nice.  Maybe that’s where Theresa Halbach is hidden.  The maps were working fine before this app update.   I understand that this has always been the case but it is SO TERRIBLE that you have to redo your entire map if some little thing is wrong.  iRobot needs to work on and release a feature where you can fill in missing zones/delete zones of a map rather than wait hours and hours for a retraining run and hope the new map is right.

title: iRobot Roomba 960
text: Amazing! Right out of the box I charged Robi, downloaded the app and that’s how she got her name. I have a two dogs and the first time through I had to empty the tray a few times but if you run her daily or every other day that eliminates the emptying the tray issue. She does a really good job and I love the notifications she gives you when the tray is full and when she gets stuck and when she’s done. I love the map after she’s done that show how much she cleaned and you can see where she missed. The only thing I could say negative about her if anything is the tray is to small but if you use it regular it’s no problem.

title: Had it for 6 months
text:
We’ve had our 960 Roomba for about 6 months now. I absolutely love it. My husband and I have 3 kids and a St. Bernard that had awful allergies and sheds in the summer to the point where he’s bald. The vet had to put him on steroids it’s so bad. I digress though. 
The app works great. You can set up a schedule so it runs every night. You can see a map of he floor it cleaned. If it had a problem you get a notification of what went wrong. For example, “bin is full” or “left wheel stuck”. I gave it 4 stars and not 5 simply because we have issues with it disconnecting from the WiFi. But in the 6 months we’ve had it it’s only happened like twice. 
Love the Roomba, love the app.

title: Awesome gadget!
text:
I received my Roomba for Christmas, fortunately two months early, and I am absolutely awestruck with the technology. This is the best item I've ever purchased for my house. It has a mind of its own, I come home and the ridges in my carpeting let me know that my rumba has been running free throughout the house in my absence. It does an absolutely awesome job!
And when I am working virtually from home, my Roomba comes in to visit me. Like having someone home with you but without the interruptions.
I need to buy one for each floor. This way all three could be running at the same time!!!!!

title: Love it!
text: I spent almost 300$ on the Bissell cross wave pet pro less than 6 months ago because everyone I know that has had a robot vacuum they quite working less than a year old, so I didn’t get one at first. I wasn’t a big fan of the cross wave from the start. I have loved my robot vacuum from day one! Coming home to clean floors with a dog and 2 kids is amazing! I will update in a year so see if it stops working before getting moneys worth out of it. I clean the charging station and vacuum after every use, I’m hoping that helps it last longer than a year Bc I love it!

title: App makes cleaning a breeze!
text:
I love this app! It makes scheduling so easy. It also shows where it cleaned. Setup was easy. 

I bought this Roomba, after buying two others, because it was suppose to empty itself and I would only have to change bags in the tower every 30 days. All true! The app maps out the rooms and you can tell your Roomba where to clean. Gets around the house easily. 

I had back surgery and bending wasn't an option. I had a caretaker for a few months and she cleaned the house and was awesome. I knew she would be leaving and I needed something to help.

I don’t have to bend much to change bags - could sit on a chair. The app and Roomba are life changers!  I have two dogs that shed like crazy. I wake up to a clean house every morning. I run it at night while I the dogs and I sleep. Do my bedroom and bath in the daytime. 

You do need to take out the rollers every few weeks and clean them...the ends especially. Also under the steering rubber wheel. Other than that it is easy and awesome!

title: Love it but a few wishes.
text: I want to give Roomba 5 stars but I hold back for a few reasons. Let me say it cleans great before I complain a little. My biggest thing is the map. We bought Roomba during a remodel. When the remodel was completed it vacuumed the new spaces but those spaces overlap previously mapped area. I want to combine parts of the map, that is redraw the room boundaries and rename them but that is not an option. Then there is it’s navigation of rugs, we have started picking up our lighter rugs so it doesn’t just push them around. And finally, accessories like the virtual wall are over priced. It’s easier to just block things with a box.

title: App not allowing to login and saying check internet Connection
text:
I am having hard time in getting into the app since this morning. Was able to use the app till this morning after that it started giving issues. So I have deleted app and reinstalled it and as soon as click login button to enter my credentials it is not taking me to the screen where I can enter my credentials instead it saying”your mobile device is offline . Please check your internet connection” if there is a problem with my internet connection how come I able to download the app and app was able to navigate till welcome screen. Been on call with tech support and they just told it is general issue and hang up the call.
Are you guys fixing this issues? If so when can we expect the resolution?

title: Best. Gift. Ever.
text: My husband bought this for me as a Mother’s Day gift. He thought it would be nice to get me something to help lighten the load of the house chore burdens for me so that I may spend more time with my family. He was right on. This robot vacuum has been so great! We will soon be getting another one for the second level of our house so that we don’t have to move this one up and down anymore. The app is the selling point. There were several times where I’ve been away from home and realized I needed it to run and was able to start it from wherever I was. We have two cats, one dog, and four children.

title: Something you really need to know.
text: The efficiency of these units depends on the air pushed out of the dust bin by the tiny little fan. That means the dust bin filter materials and openings in the filter media are critical to your experience. There are a plethora of off brand filters offered for Roomba devices, and a huge amount of them look feel and smell as the OEM filter does, but they are too restrictive to the air flow and that reduces the fans ability to create enough vacuum in the dust bin. Buy the Roomba filters and save yourself the headache of dealing with little to no vacuum. iRobot got the four because there are no fives and the help desk never asked me if I was using Roomba filters.

title: i7 great at first. Now just good
text:
Good little helper. First few months the room a cleaned like a charm. It seems after a few months it just doesn’t do quite what it once did. We’ve changed out all the rollers and filters etc. It’s sucked up some pretty impressive things though… kids socks, dog food, change, playing cards, many electrical cords. And for some reason it tries so hard to get under the couch in one particular spot and gets stuck every time. 

All in all we mostly love it. It also encourages the kids to pick stuff up off the floor or it will get stuck and eat their toys… so yeah, that alone I’d recommend it!

title: Not Great
text:
This app is junk. Just installed the latest update and now it says I don’t have an internet connection - which I definitely do. 

The algorithms that control the robot are also weak - it constantly runs out of batteries in the middle of a run. Why isn’t it smart enough to return home to recharge? 

Overall not impressed by the app or the product. This needs some serious engineering effort to become world class. It’s not worth anywhere near what they charge for these products and it’s definitely still an early adopter product - I.e when the market is more mature these products will be completely worthless. They are only remotely useful now because they are unique.

title: Exceptional cleaning
text: I had a robot many years ago, one of the first ones. It was always getting stuck somewhere. But now the technology is just incredible and getting even better every day. I hesitated to get another robot but my dog sheds so bad that I would have to vacuum literally every day and could not keep up with it. So now rumba cleans my floors four days a week and I never see hair anymore. I can’t wait for them to make one that can go upstairs. Lol  It was a worth while expense. cheaper than hiring a maid  that only comes once a week. Thank you rumba

title: The BEST Appliance in my house!
text:
We have 3 dogs, 5+ people in our house at all times & needed daily vacuuming to even begin to keep up with the dirt and mess.
Alejandro(My iRobot's name, LOL) is awesome and a lifesaver. Oh I scheduled him to run at different times, different days so I don't need to hear it and do the whole house when we leave.
Love the lines he makes in the carpet and how he maneuvers around obstacles without banging into them, knocking things down or breaking things. The automatic bag emptying works fantastic also.
The bags are kind of pricey, but I found generic ones that work just fine :-)

title: Fantastic machine
text:
We have had ours for a year now and it runs every day. We have four dogs (shedding a lot), so it really helps coming home to a clean house every day.
It is easy to maintain and clean. A daily routine every morning spending a few minutes to empty an clean the bin and the rollers. After that the room a does it’s job every day. 
Like the app, where we can see the daily map of where it has cleaned. Normally it runs about 1 hot and ten minutes to clean the entire downstairs (hallway, two living rooms, bathroom, office, kitchen and laundry room).
This machine is worth every penny.

title: Rosie
text: I checked out virtually all brands and sizes of various “robot” vacuums and read all the reviews I could find and made the move, paid a little more, and finally decided on a Roomba 980......excellent choice!!  Easy to set up the app, does a superb job of cleaning, covers the whole house, carpet or tile or wood floors, climbs over throw rugs and really rarely gets hung up, anywhere!!  I love it!  Surprised how much dirt it actually picked up.  The “dust trap” is small and filled up a few times during the first few runs, but, now, the house is so clean, it rarely fills up during a single run.  I got in the habit of running “Rosie” twice a week (sometimes 3.  Love it!!

title: V3.5 mapping now working.
text:
Update. A day after I wrote this review now new runs are now making maps.  The old ones that didn’t have a map still don’t.  Weird but it’s working. Update to 4 stars.  I’ll make it 5 stars when I can chose to clean every other day or every day etc. rather than specific days of the week.  

I’ve never had an issue with the app until this update.  Now my Roomba will not create maps since the update.  All previous times still have their maps.  I’ve tried rebooting the Roomba and reinstalling the app.  The problem is with the update and all the recent reviews confirm that.   Please update your app and fix this issue.

title: Love my Roomba
text: I was very skeptical about this purchase, specially after reading some reviews but after owning my Roomba vacuum for a month I’m convinced it has been one of the beat purchases I’ve made. It is efficient, powerful and It’s only gotten stuck once and that was totally my fault. I would say if you are skeptical about it just try it out and see for your self. We all have different spaces and what didn’t work for some may very well work for others. The app is great I can always get it to do exactly what I want and the alexa feature is awesome!

title: Great device- cleans better than anyone in my household
text: I hate to vacuum. Basically I hate house cleaning of any sort and when Covid hit, no more cleaning service. So my niece and sister convinced me to get the Roomba i7. I love it. Simple to set up, cleans great and now my house in the country is dirt free and fur free (3 indoor cats and a medium sized dog. We did not know if it could handle the uneven floors, sloping back porch floor, old thresholds of an early 18th century house, but it is a champion. Its sensors for stairs and drop offs is perfect. Imagine a house build long ago with hand tools is now cleaned by a robot. The ghosts must be amazed or amused. I’m just happy.

title: I6 exceeded our expectations
text: We’ve had a 500 series Roomba for many years.  Because of reviews saying the new robot vacuums were much improved and because the i6 was on sale for a short time, we decided to give it a try. We’ve had it for about a month now and we’re very happy with it.  We’ve got it set up on a schedule so there’s virtually nothing we have to do to have our house vacuumed. So far it seems to do an excellent job of cleaning our floors.  This is one of the first smart home upgrades that we thought was a giant leap forward.

title: Absolutely love this thing!
text:
We have two Samoyeds and this thing is a life saver. The spinners in the bottom of this machine are rubber. So you don’t have to constantly take it apart and clean (cut out) the dog hair like we do with our Eufy machine AND it empties its own bin so we don’t have to constantly check and make sure it’s not full. 
Only down side is that it’s too tall to fit under our furniture.
The Eufy does fit under all our couches, coffee tables and entertainment/tv stand. Which is super nice. 
I will keep my eye out for ab updated version of this machine that has a slimmer profile.

title: I robot Romba I-8
text: We are beyond impressed with “Hairy Bluehair” My house has never looked better. The wood floors shine and the rugs and carpets are fluffy. We are on our 2nd week with 3 cleaning schedules per week covering approx. 2000 square feet. It takes him 9 hours and 12 dumps if we let him complete his task. This sounds like a lot but he has to maneuver around a lot of furniture and the fact that we have 2 hairy Pugs. He’s definitely the right man for the job. I can’t believe I waited so long to bite the bullet. Bought at Costco last month with a $100 off deal. Don’t wait, run to get one.

title: Works great after help from the iRobot team
text: Like many others I too had many of the problems indicated in the customer reviews. I sent an email detailing what my problems were. They connected to my iRobot and they determined my battery was not charging so they provided detail instructions on how to fix this. Then with the problem of connecting still happening, followed their instructions but I decided to delete my WiFi connection and reinstall and making sure I connected to 2g instead of 5g. I have had no problems since.

title: Love my roomba but there are some FLAWS!
text:
I have owned an eye series roomba since December 2020 and it has definitely changed the way I do cleaning around the house. It saves time, and I haven’t manually vacuumed in forever. 

However, there is a huge problem with this particular model. After the first couple of months it worked perfectly, but it keeps dropping Wi-Fi and I always get an error saying not connected. It’s so irritating. There is not a really simple fix either. You end up having to either reboot, or restore to factory settings or change Wi-Fi. It’s a pain when you have to do this once a week or more than once a week. Needs to be fixed.

title: Maps do not update
text: I don’t want to rate this app too low over one issue, but I think it’s the primary function of this app.  The map of my house does not update despite running “clean everything” runs.  This is an issue with both my roomba and braava jet.  I’ve seen it hit sections on a complete run and then skip them on individual room runs because the map won’t update.  There’s an option where you can have it replace your saved map with a map made on a complete run you just finished, but that run seems to only claim it hit whatever the saved map already had, not acknowledging other areas that it did hit.  It’s very frustrating.

title: Needs to complete one task at a time.
text:
The AI software needs to have added a rule to complete a area at a time.  For instance, when it is cleaning around the kitchen table and runs into objects (chair legs), it proceeds to clean the rest of the kitchen area.  I pull the chairs out from under the table into the cleaned area.  It appears programming it to re-attempt cleaning in the missed areas (original chair leg areas) and the edges.  
  Now of course no matter where one moves the chair it is in the as iRobot appears to jump back and forth between missed area cleaning and edge cleaning.
  It is out “smarting” me on where to move the chair to give it a clear path.  Lol, sort of.

title: Good stuff, but needs a lot improvement
text:
1, algorithm needs improvement. Even set for one path, it still repeatedly run over places multiple times. And often not swipe through efficiently by going to the adjacent path. Rather move to the other end of room, swipes a few places then come back.
2, learning function is weak. Thought with fixed layout, it could learn after a few swiping through, therefore could do a better job. Looks like it could only “remember” the bumps. 
3, wish I can see the cleaning stage on a live map. Now I can only see the map after the cleaning is done.

title: Welcome addition to my home
text: Purchased the top ‘o the line combo vacuum and mop devices and very impressed. The mapping technology has improved immensely since the days of the robots that seemed to wander randomly until they thought the job was done (yes, I realize it was a lot more complex but it sure looked random). So nice to be able to send the devices in sequence to specific room/rooms whenever needed. And the vacuum emptying itself into the base is what makes the biggest difference to me— no more emptying a dusty bin into the garbage only to get the floor dirty again as you’re doing it. Thanks Roomba.

title: I purchased “Rosie” to save time…
text:
But I find myself watching “Rosie” save me time!  Ha ha!  If you take the plunge and make the purchase, you’ll see!!! 

I am amazed at the technology integrated into this device and have an appreciation for the apps ease of use.  In all honesty, this purchase has encouraged my son and me to keep items off of the floor and be more organized.   “Rosie” has definitely given this single mom a little more time to do the fun things in life.  

p.s.  I purchased this as a bundle which includes the s9+vacuum, the Clean Base bin and “Elroy” the m6 Robot Mop.  We are just as happy with the bin and “Elroy”!

title: Roomba I-Robot does the job
text:
Enjoying our Roomba. Does a very good job vacuuming, even sand that gets tracked in. Love the automatic trash collector so we don’t have to empty the bin ourselves. Trash bags hold a number of vacuumings. Follows the individualized schedule. The app is easy to use. 

Roomba does get stuck under cabinet doors and on the side of a slanted surface so we often have to rescue it to complete the job. When this happens we will manually empty the bin and check on the rollers to keep it functioning. Of course it can’t get into all spaces and corners so a supplemental vacuuming is occasionally necessary. 

Recommend

title: Big disappointment
text: Buyer beware. These iRobots and Roombas look great on paper but get one in your home and you’ll be disappointed. I live in a 3,000 square-foot home. Each level is 1000 square-feet. It takes 3 to 4 hours to vacuum 1000 square-feet. More times than not I can spot an entire room that hardly got vacuumed when this iRobot tells me it is done with the job. I can vacuum the whole house, all three levels manually in 30-45 minutes. Also, the waste bin needs to be emptied 3 times in those 5 hours. For more money, iRobot has added a vacuum that can empty it’s waste bin so it can keep vacuuming without being emptied but will still take a silly amount of time to clean the floors in your home. Consider all of this when buying one.

title: Love Oscar!
text: We named our Roomba Oscar. Our i7 with self emptying feature is wonderful, well worth the extra cost as and so easy to use. It mapped out the whole house and now I can just choose which room I want vacuumed. I go around and pick up objects to make sure there is nothing as far as obstructions to prevent Oscar from vacuuming or getting stuck.  It only takes me a few minutes then Oscar does the rest. I can leave, or schedule it while I’m away. Remember, it is a vacuum so there is some noise, but it’s nothing like an upright. So glad we have this little guy!

title: I call her Brat
text: I call her BRAT, because when she is vacuuming, she finds everything that I did not pick up out of her way. This vacuum keeps my house cleaner than it’s been in years. I have 2 dogs that shed constantly and before I just couldn’t vacuum daily. With having artificial hips and rods down my spine, it makes vacuuming so painful. Now Brat does the work for me and my husband fills in when he feels like it. Also, dog hair is not a problem. No clogging, and absolutely no dumping the dirt daily. I love that I only change out the tower bag monthly or sometimes longer.

title: Not good for pet hair and not easy to map
text: Our Roomba is great on tile floors, but we have 2 dogs and all it does is push around the pet hair on the carpet. This is very disappointing.  We had another brand, much cheaper, that sucked up all the pet hair and was thinking this would be the same. After using it on carpet we then have to go around and either pick up the piles of pet hair it leaves or vacuum.  As for the app, we had problems getting the Roomba to stay in certain parts of the house.  There is still one bedroom that is not mapped because if we put it in the room it goes back out. If we close the door, it ends the job stuck. Very frustrating to try to create a schedule when it doesn’t recognize the entire house.

title: (BUSTED APP) no longer
text:
Had the issue below for a few days but seems to be resolved now.

At some point very recently, I go into the app and it shows the i7 is connected and a current status, but seconds later it changes to a status of “Not Connected” and from that point nothing in the app works. No maps, no favorites, MAYBE a history. Can’t create or start a job. The only way to get the thing to do it’s job is to push the button on it, but that’s not what I paid for. Pretty surprised this is the current product offering as I’ve always spoken highly of this thing prior to this.

title: App works great... but...
text:
The App works great, but I’d like to suggest a couple improvements.  Specifically, when the roomba is charging or paused because of a jam, you have only two options, continue to clean, or cancel.  If you’d like to make changes to the schedule, or show off the features to a friend, you must cancel the cleaning job first to be able to get to the rest of the app.  It would be great to have full access to the app at all times.

Also, for whatever reason, there is not always a map.  Being able to see where it’s cleaned has been awesome as well.

Beyond that, the app is great, seeing what’s happening and where the roomba has cleaned is great.

title: iRobot Select is worth it!
text:
The idea of paying a subscription fee for a vacuum seems really stupid. But when you have five kids under the age of 12 in one household, it suddenly makes more sense. We run “Wilma“ several hours every day and it has helped keep our home much nicer. 

Even our two year old does a better job of picking things off of the floor so Wilma “doesn’t get a bellyache“. A subscription service for a vacuum is certainly not for everyone, but for us it is well worth the money and while we don’t have enough money to hire someone to do our cleaning, we can afford this “luxury“.

title: From Sebastian to Hazel
text: We purchased the first one and loved it until it got stuck under things. We readjusted furniture, and moved it’s home spot. Worked like a charm occasionally a dogs toy got stuck. Recommended it to many friends. Then we got a new 960 and Hazel and the app have been great. Got new and better wi-fi which helped. My only suggestion is maybe the app could tell you where it is stuck. Vs having to search for it. But still we love. Had a lab and it got his hair up everyday. He shed a lot too. Had to empty the bin everyday. Now it’s weekly

title: Absolute Worst
text:
UPDATE: Well, I’m back to using my regular vacuum. My once fantastic, reliable i7 is now a very expensive doorstop. This latest update made already very bad things even worse. I simply don’t have the time to mess with the thing anymore. Consider me a very upset, disappointed former customer. 

I have no idea what they’ve done to the Roomba software, but now my Roomba doesn’t work right and hasn’t since the latest version of the software was released. Perhaps it was a firmware update that’s the problem, I don’t know. What I do know is my once 100% reliable Roomba i7 is now barely usable. And the latest Roomba app is an unmitigated disaster. Extremely non-intuitive, commands and options that only show up occasionally, etc., etc. I’d give the app less than 1 star if I could, it’s that bad.

title: Not super efficient
text:
Our i7 iRobit vacuum, Howard, has been somewhat unreliable and he’s kind of all over the place in terms of efficiency. 
Sometimes he gets back to his station to recharge by himself, and others he just stops in the middle of the room out of energy, or it gets back to his face but is unable to connect to the charging marks. 
When he’s vacuuming, sometimes he goes back and forth in a nice neat rows, and other times he turns in circles, vacuum only part of a room and then leaves to vacuum part of another room, or misses big swaths of floor altogether. 
It’s better than nothing to have him doing what he does, but not even close to the same as me vacuuming by hand.

title: Best robovac ever!
text: After going through three other brands (all fairly decent), we bought an iRobot 7+ last year and man, the self cleaning and dustbin are second to none! We returned two other brands bought for comparison and to use at our rental property, but there is no other self cleaning robovac out there now that comes even close to the powerful suction, consistent and equally powerful self clean bin and the ability to remotely control the vac through the app or smarthome configurations through Google Home and Alexa. Lifesaver for busy family of 6 & 2 dogs.

title: App does Not allow multiple users in a household
text: In general the app works.  However, every so often the iRobot app logs me out and asks for a username/email and password.  My complaint is that we cannot have two emails and passwords for the same account for our household. If my husband is on a business trip or unavailable when the app asks for a password, I can’t use my iRobot because I don’t have access to his email to validate my user access. Additionally, when I try to set up my own account, the app doesn’t allow it. Even the bank allows us to have multiple usernames/emails associated with a household. Please consider changing this restriction.

title: Yolanda (iRobot)
text: Yolanda (iRobot) is not working very well. The charger or base quit working a  while back and Yolanda started acting strange not to long ago. She stopped emptying her bin so we are having to do that two or three times while she vacuums the floors in our house.  I am handicapped so that is an inconvenience but I guess t hat is part of it. She stopped emptying her bin into the base herself so we started putting using the application buttons ourselves but one day the “Empty Bin”  Now the “Empty Bin” button has disappeared so I can’t do that. Yolanda has been having problems deciding what to do and where to go.  She starts out from base and goes in circles. She spends around in circles not knowing which way to go.  She finally stops spinning and will start going someplace.

title: IRobot 981 was better
text: I replaced my 981 with i7 thinking it is the latest model ..but I am really disappointed with its performance..981 use to take its own time and did a thorough job..i7 I feel it is in a hurry to finish the work and get back home. I always had it cleaning not more than 25 mins..whereas the 981 was more powerful and its cleaning time would vary based on how unclean the room is. ..I have seen it clean for 45 mins and then charge again and restart With i7 I always see lot of areas left unclean ..I don’t know whether I made a right decision to replace my 981 . I would appreciate if some experts from the company calls and let me know how to get this working as expected

title: Version 5.2 Is unusable
text: I have had no issues with the previous version. However, version 5.2 was updated on my mini iPad and iPhone 6 days ago. Now when I open the app it goes to the iRobot graphic, shows the indication that it is trying to do something, and within a couple of seconds an error pops up indicating my mobile device is not connected to the internet. At this point I try the retry button with the same error. The only thing you can do at this point is close the app. I immediately run Speedtest on my device and find no issues with my device connection to the internet. Sorry to say but this iRobot home app version is completely and utterly useless. I have no control of my iRobot 900 making it no more than a paper weight on wheels.

title: Why didn’t I get one sooner?!
text: I can’t believe how well my Roomba cleans under everything and right up to the baseboards. Really a clean house game changer. I had low expectations thinking that at least if it picked up a little bit that was less for me to do. But WOW, this doesn’t leave a speck of dirt. It does make a little noise as it works, so if you’re sensitive to that just schedule when you’re out. Highly recommend the vacuum. The brava jet mop is also useful but just for touch ups. Not as revolutionary as the vacuum yet. But I bet they are improving.

title: Works well except
text: Everything has been a breeze to set up and it works very well, but on my app it never loads the “schedule tab”. I click on it and it is just blank with no options to toggle on and off days. I have tried departing and reinstalling with no luck. Can anyone help......update, the roomba began to start at strange times without any command, like at 1 and 7 in the morning while everyone is sleeping. Ended up doing a factory reset on the roomba through the app and when I repaired it the schedule tab started working and havnt had any more issues. Hope this helps someone

title: Recent update- i7 Not good.
text:
Update: 26Oct2020..... my device is no longer communicating to the cloud. It makes it seem like it’s paused in cleaning but it’s on the base fully charged. If you keep hiring, pause/resume it finally lets you know of the communication issue. My internet is working fine. But the device hasn’t worked per schedule in a week. I even reset it AND my internet... nope nothing happens. Please fix it. 

Previous: Roomba doesn’t clean fully and now gets lost. It’s no longer going over my area rug. It’s not going to other places it used to clean. It’s going into areas beyond the selected rooms I specified. Would be nice for the map to auto update or for you to be able to re-map your home. This needs another update but test it first before you push it out.

title: v5 design worse in every way
text:
The iRobot app was previously poorly planned and designed, with missing features and some of the least empathetically designed UX of any app I use regularly. 

In v5, iRobot made the same app aesthetically more attractive and even worse in terms of usability, in terms of being able to find the information or function you’re looking for, viewing information, or intuitiveness of layout. 

This app should be blown up and restarted from scratch. Hire a professional user researcher, talk to some customers, design a UX model, and then design the app. Visual design updated on a badly designed UX might be fun to show off in your executive presentations for for your board members, but for your customers, you failed.

title: Not thrilled with iRobot e6, like Neato better
text:
I have had a Neato VX12 for about 10 years. Costco had the iRobot e6 on sale. So I decided to give it a try. I ran about 10 times. 
iRobot does a better job along the walls because my Neato old version did not have the side sweep bristle back then. 
However, I do not like the iRobot diagonal path routes. They seem less efficient. 
Neato lightly bumps furniture much gentler then iRobot. 
iRobot did not return to base four out of ten times. I found him stopped in different locations for no reason at all when it should have returned to the base. 
Neato returns to base pretty much always to recharge to continue or when finished unless something has trapped it. Rarely. 
iRobot needs battery operated post to stay out of areas. 
Neato can be prevented in areas by using a movable magnetic strip on the floor. I like it as an option. 
I have even put it under a medium pile carpet and it detects the magnet barrier. 
The iRobot isn’t bad but I like Neato better. 
I returned the iRobot. Maybe the 900 series are better. Not spending that much money though.

title: Woo. A great investment.
text:
Very futuristic. There’s always room for improvement but this will do for me for now. This robot Vac saves me a ton of time. It does not do as good a job as I. (Haha) but I can run this a couple more times when needed. It never gets tired and hungry or angry. Nice

The thing is. I don’t feel like a slave in my own house anymore. I stop being angry with my husband for never sweeping the floor nor help move the furniture nor acknowledge nor appreciate my efforts when I sweep. 

I bought this over a year ago and I changed the dirt bag only once. Ya. Money well spent.

title: Works great in our church!
text:
We have many members who are older than when they first arrived and became a member. Some of them cleaned and vacuumed the floor. In thanks to them for their many years of service, we bought the iRobot to help them not have to bend over and push the vacuum around themselves.

It has worked terrific! It’s vacuums when everybody’s gone and nobody has to stay behind to take care of the vacuuming. After it finishes it goes back to recharge and run when it is next scheduled. The iRobot, like our members, is and has been a faithful servant!  ;-)

title: Not only is my Roomba amazing so is this App
text: Holy smokes!! I have only had my Roomba for a week but I seriously love it!! I have a German Shepherd and a golden retriever and their hair is EVERYWHERE!! My little Roomba gets EVERYTHING!!! I just wish her little dustbin was bigger!! But that’s the good thing about this App!! Whenever her dustbin is full of her wheel is stuck I get the notification and I can even locate where she is in the house with it! I can get instructions on how to fix an issue straight on the app or even order parts without having to google around and try to find it!! That just makes me life so much easier!

title: Love my Roomba
text: I have two children who are wonderful, but also drop things everywhere.  If you have a relatively level floor plan and typically vacuum once a week but should do it every couple of days to avoid stepping on stuff, get a Roomba.  I set it to run every day after I leave for work and I come home to clean floors.  The app is great.  Getting reports on where it cleaned gives you immediate feedback on where it’s getting to in your house (it can get into a lot of places).  We splurged for the top of the line model and it easily handles cat hair and all manner of messes left by my five and two year olds.

title: Love it so far
text: I’ve only had the i7 for a few weeks, but my home is so much cleaner. It cleans in places I normally don’t get to (think under the bed, dressers, nooks) so all of the little dust bunnies that float out after I clean are gone. I have four kids, two dogs, and three birds, and this thing can handle everything. I got the self emptying dock which I think I really important— it empties at least once in a cleaning cycle and I’m so glad I don’t have to deal with doing it myself (I love running it while I’m at work!). GREAT purchase, so far I am super happy!

title: Amazing
text: If you are trying to decide to buy or not, just do it! I have been so happy with this roomba. I bought the i3 and it works spectacular! We have a dog and she is shedding like crazy. I have it set to clean every other day, but sometimes (with kids and a dog) I need an extra cleaning day and it cleans it all! From dog hair, to mine and my girls long hair, to food crumbs  and tiny dirt particles. I couldn’t be happier. Best little helper! It also fits right under my counters and my dining room chairs! Also, super easy to clean and gets long hair out! You won’t regret this buy.

title: My twins
text: I have a single story house, rather spread out. With two i robots, I split the area in half and they each take about 55 minutes, which is a good cycle for these, they last about an hour and a quarter before they head back to charge on they’re own. Way too big a house for one I robot, and they hate being moved to new territories. I made my own adapter to my yard vac to clean bin. Make sure and open filter door. You’ll spin little motor up to one million rpm. I’ve bought three. Now I remember. I write on tape on door, ‘open stupid’

title: Good, needs some work
text:
I have a i8 model, I have run mapping runs dozens of times and still a few places do not appear.  I even create a clean zone over it, it cleans it, and still nothing.   The biggest issue is that any change of the map deletes your whole schedule.  I added a no clean zone near the Christmas tree and all my schedules deleted.  As soon as Christmas is over it will delete them all again.   Not sure why small change to the map require a full schedule deletion.  Keep the 95% that is not affected, or just mark it so it’s an easy fix.

Update, got some emails from iRobot, removed the app, re-add, still the same.  I even sent in a video.  Now they have stopped responding. That’s helpful.  Will try a new one from Costco and then kicking it to the curb

title: Not sure if it’s an app or roomba
text: I purchased an I7 10 days ago.  The first one worked but the map would not update.  It kept saying there was an issue.  Called customer service (over 2 hours mostly waiting for my turn in the que) and they shipped a replacement roomba. Five days later it arrived and it won’t leave move off the docking station because it’s sensors think it’s on a cliff.  I spent another hour and half on the phone with support and now they have submitted it to the escalation department.  I called this morning for an update to learn it was never submitted.  Now the clock starts over to determine how they are going to handle it.   I don’t know what’s related to the app but fair warning that this is not the experience or quality you expect for a $600 investment.

title: Decent App with a few requests
text: Really this app is pretty well suited for me and my use of our Roomba. The only thing I wish is - unless I can’t find it - a notification when the Roombas battery is fully charged. There are many times when I leave the house or want to start it after it’s been on the dock but I forget when out and about all day. If it would/could notify my when it’s fully charged, after recently docking it would be so helpful! I feel if it can notify me of cliffs, dead battery, and others it should be able to notify me of full battery too.

title: App is truly terrible
text:
There’s really no excuse at this point. Y’all need to focus on fixing this app so it’s actually functional. Last year it would sometimes work—I’d have to close the app 10-15 times and then I’d finally be able to connect. More often than not it would say it couldn’t connect. I have good WiFi so that is not the issue. 

The last few weeks the app has been entirely unusable. Maps are not being saved. I can’t even start the vacuum remotely because it now has the message “cannot start, low battery” 100% of the time, even when the roomba has a full charge. 

I’ve deleted the app and reset everything so many times I’ve lost count. If we’re paying hundreds of dollars for this we should at least get a working app

title: Acceptable Servant
text: I like the robot vacuum overall and my floors have never been cleaner. I was worried that pet hair would overwhelm it, but except for one shortcoming, that worry was unfounded. That exception is that getting the robot vacuum to work well both requires modifying your living space - cords, rugs, and furniture - and tending to it's bin religiously. My home requires more than a single charge to vacuum the entire floor, about two recharges during a cleaning cycle. During each charging, I find I must empty it's bin in order to allow it to complete it's job. It would be nice if the bin and sensors we're larger and more resilient.

title: First week was great!
text: I have a less expensive Roomba model; but it does  have WiFi available.  The first week I used the app to schedule cleanings it worked great!  The second week I had to change the time on a couple of the scheduled days because...well, life...and since doing that I’ve noticed that it doesn’t run consistently anymore.  I’ll check the time for the scheduled cleaning and it will be passed the time and no cleaning so I’ll just have to start it up manually.  It’s done this several different days this week.  I’m not sure what’s going on.  But I thought the feedback might help with the app improvement moving forward.

title: Mr Clean I900 Series
text: I don’t know how I ever got along without my IRobot. I am elderly and have a Housekkeeper that comes bi-weekly.  She loves it too. She noticed right away that she didn’t have hardly any pet hair to clean up. I run it daily in the morning except for the days she comes, so even 24 hours later she wasn’t getting a lot of pet hair. Once she told me that, I knew how good a job it was doing. I recommend it to anyone that has a pet. Next time I’ll get the one that self empties the bin. My Daughter just got one of those a few days ago and she loves it.

title: Hey, it’s not annoying!
text:
I had a 700 series Roomba that I just loved, but, let’s face it, It has all of the annoying charm of a two-year-old without the actual charm. It was noisy, non-white things like table legs and chairs and peoples feet took a pretty good beating from the thing, and it’s behavior of “investigating” unexpected obstacles by repeatedly pushing against them could be infuriating.

My new 960 seems to have solved all of those problems. Compared to the 700, it is almost silent. It’s much smarter about approaching and investigating obstacles. And, as a techno-geek, I think the coverage map and Wi-Fi map are totally cool.

title: Great vacuum, but virtual walls not very accurate.
text: We love this vacuum, but part of the reason we got it was for the benefit of virtual walls. We have a sofa and a corner of our kitchen that previous robot vacuums have gotten stuck under. By putting a virtual wall in that corner of our kitchen, the robot will not even cross the hallway on the other side of the wall. By putting the virtual wall around the sofa, but within its boundaries, the vacuum avoids it in a 3 foot parameter all the way around. When we narrow that virtual wall, it avoids part of it and still gets stuck under part of it. I’m not sure that the virtual walls should even be advertised as a selling feature at this point.

title: Update/downgrade
text:
This piece of junk won’t even charge anymore! I’ve done all the trouble shooting that’s offered... I know I’m not the only one that’s had trouble! Big mistake! It lasted less then 2 months, for that price I could have easily hired someone to sweep my floors once a week come on, what a waste of money!

My Roomba i7+ worked amazing before the last update, then it completely fell on its face. I managed to get it working decent again,(with no help from iRobot I might add). But now, half the time it won’t charge after returning to its base,(only empties bin 2/3 of the time)!.. can’t imagine that’s an issue with the app but it had no issues (at all) before the last update. I’m sure the app developers are failing, starting to wonder if the robot itself is junk. A Pricey lesson on technology! ($1,100)MISTAKE...

title: Wonder why we have cleaning people!?!?
text: Roomba 980 is amazing.  I love my this new toy/gadget.  My husband and I live in the house about 3000 sq ft.  We had cleaning ladies who clean the house on Saturday.  Roomba arrived at Saturday evening.  So I charged it up over night.  On Sunday I started letting Roomba run around. Oh my my, I was so surprised to see how much dog hair and dust Roomba collects!  It almost suggested me why we still have cleaning ladies;(. Roomba took almost 4 hours to clean our entire downstairs about  1400 sq ft.  It also let me know the bin was full twice.  My husband and I both suffer from allergy.  Hope this Roomba helps us feel better!

title: Critical Must Have with Pets that Shed
text:
The most important tech is the iRobot vacuum when you have pets that shed.  We love German Shepherds (GSD) but they shed a lot.  We prepared our home for 2 new GSD puppies in two ways.  First we replaced all carpet and tile with the same ceramic tile that looks just like hardwood floors.  Second, and most importantly, we purchased an iRobot vacuum with the Clean Base automatic dirt removal that empties and charges the vacuum.

We always wanted a robot vacuum but we didn’t want to have to empty the dust bin by hand and plug it in by hand.

The iRobot Clean Base takes care of both for us so we basically set it and forget it.  I do check it once a week to make sure everything on the vacuum is great but it is really well made and low maintenance.  

Best of all, it helps us keep up with the shedding to the point where you wouldn’t know we have doge unless you actually see them.

Best investment ever!

title: Weird date
text: I have the roomba 690. The app works ok just basic. Can’t get a map of what was cleaned. About once a month the schedule stops working but still connected. I go to the history and has a date of Dec. 31, 1969. Did it get hacked? When I set up the app and have to connect to the roomba it says insecure network. With the roomba having a camera on it and not being able to view that myself my questions would be who can view it with an insecure network. After I get the 1969 date it will no longer start itself. I have to clean out the roomba and start all over just to get that date in another month. Definitely needs better security especially if we need an account and use our own WiFi credentials.

title: Not intuitive and unpredictable
text: The app is ok. It has unpredictable bouts of not linking with the roomba or giving incorrect information and I don’t find the app functions intuitive. It has in the immediate action tabs things you don’t really need and you have to dig for ones you want. Sometimes it will say it’s charging and then you go and look and it had trouble docking and is sitting in the middle of the living room. It works like all iRobot products, well enough that you keep it around but not good enough to where you recommend it to someone or brag about how great it is. It’s just meh, not the Cobb salad of robot vacuums more like house salad.

title: I love my roomba!
text: I’ve had it for 3 years and I just can’t imagine life without it. What a smart and convenient device. It gets up the dirt and is smart about areas that need extra. It goes back over these spots. I set up a schedule and that was it. Using the app is so easy too.  I have hard wood and ceramic tile throughout my home. There are area rugs and roomba cleans all of it. My floors never looked better this consistently. I like how I can stop a cleaning or start a quick clean in one specific area. Like I said. I love my Roomba!!

title: Vacuums never work
text: I have to do my best to recommend anyone to NOT purchase one of these vacuums. The first one we ordered would just spin in circles for hours and get nothing done. So we returned it, and while the second one will actually vacuum, it is extremely rare for it to get through vacuuming without randomly running out of battery without charging itself, getting stuck someplace, saying it’s clogged, etc. We’ve had this one for around 2.5 months now and only once has it vacuumed the entire area it’s in without needing some sort of help or just shutting down. I wish we returned this one after the first time it failed and tried a different brand because iRobot does not seem to be able to provide a quality product.

title: A Couple of Idiosyncrasies
text:
While I like Roomba, there are a couple of idiosyncrasies that bug me, like (1) how it gets stuck under the cabinets in my kitchen and bathroom, requiring me to physically extricate it, and (2) the need to often use a hand-held vacuum to clean the dustbin, the rollers, etc. 

Particularly bothersome is how it has chipped away at the finish on the bottom of the kitchen base cabinets. While I am considering purchasing some type of attachable bumper, in the interim I’ve designated both the kitchen and bathroom as “forbidden zones” (which I was able to do on the iRobot map and why I elevated my rating from three to four stars).

title: Time saver and a great help.
text: I have orthopedic problems with my knees, shoulders and feet and mopping is quite the chore for me.  My robot does a fine job in keeping the floors sanitary. That’s important especially when the grandkids are coming for a visit, especially for the crawling stage a clean floor makes all the difference. Have never regretted this purchase, it is a time and effort saver for me and I don’t have to worry about wear snd tear on my knees, shoulders and feet and the need for a hired housekeeper has minimized, she can concentrate on things other than the floors.

title: Major flaws
text: Worked really well right up to the expiration of the 1yr warranty. Then it was problem after problem. Robot didn’t recognize the base, so call after call, they actually sent us a new base. Partially fixed the issue but the bin doesn’t want to empty on its own. You open the app and it doesn’t give you the option to empty the bin on it own either. So, you have to physically go to the robot and empty it every time. Really defeats the purpose of an automatic robot with the base. Yes, I do regular maintenance on it. Contacted IROBOT about it and without even telling me they mail us a power cable 😂 They go above and behind avoiding the problem rather than fixing the problem. We’re such regular callers that we have a case reference number.

title: Love it
text: I’m always amazed at how much it picks up even when the floor doesn’t look dirty. One thing people need to consider with “robots” is that they are like all other machines and need regular maintenance and cleaning. Yes, parts wear out and need replaced , but the same is true for any machine we don’t consider disposable. My roomba is still going great after almost 5 years of regular use. We have three dogs so it definitely has worked “hard.” I have replaced the rollers and filter but the power and mechanical parts are still great.

title: Life Saver for Pet Owners
text:
We are first time dog owners and we have a 9 month old golden. We just moved into our new home about 6 months ago and we were just devastated at the amount of dog hair we swept everyday. We had dog hair everywhere, and thats when we discovered Roomba. 
By far this is the best thing that has happened to us. Both me and my wife love the Roomba and we finally have a hair free home again. Absolutely recommended no doubts !!!! Great mapping and also the wheels can roll out of difficult corners. The best thing we like about Roomba is that it cleans through tough corners and edges.  
Love it !!!

title: Frustrating Update
text: Like many others reviewing the most recent app update I am quite disappointed and frustrated. With the release of the latest app, my i7 has barely been able to function. Oftentimes I cannot connect to the robot, it refuses to dock properly and stay on the charger, and will not clean based on the floor plan (would only clean a small section of the living room then redock and then I had to retrain it to alleviate the issue). Thus, because of the communication issues and inability to stay charged, the robot has been sitting in the corner collecting dust (and not in the way you want). I have to say I’m quite disappointed with my experience with Roomba thus far and I hope they can improve the experience for their customers.

title: May work for newer products but not iJet
text: With the most recent update this app won’t even connect to my iJet. Idk if you’re passing out iJet now that you have a newer, more expensive mopping robot but this is horrible. Don’t get me wrong, I’m none too pleased with the iJet either, for what I paid. It doesn’t listen to virtual walls, doesn’t notice changes in floor type so always tries to mop my carpet, and uses the same amount of water no matter which mopping pad I’m using. I could sort of control it with this app but now that the app won’t even find it I’m gonna say both the app and iJet are junk. This is all after having my initial iJet replaced under warranty. I have an 800 Series Room a that works fine. Maybe you should stick to your original product.

title: Great tool
text:
I absolutely love this thing. It cleans efficiently while I’m away. I did have to stay home for the first few runs. It gets under furniture I normally don’t so the dust bin filled up quickly. Now that it is caught up the dust bin isn’t a problem. 
Only concern/ complaint would be the suction itself isn’t as strong as I would like, or maybe it could use stronger more aggressive scrubbers. It rents to leave anything stuck in the carpet, in the carpet. Having a wood shop in my garage and bringing in chips and dust. It picks up a lot of that but I have noticed where items were stuck into the carpet. 
Overall highly recommended.

title: Roomba great, app not so much
text: I give the actual vacuum5 stars, or 500. It is awesome, great, I love it.  The app is frustrating.  It works well, until it doesn’t work well. Half the time it doesn’t generate the map that it is supposed to.  The other annoying glitch is, it tells me the dustbin is full, so I empty it. Then rather that resuming the job as it should,  it cancels the job. This happens 80% of the time. The only option is to restart the job from the beginning, and then it doesn’t finish because the charge runs out.  Really annoying. If they could improve the app, it would be great. But I put up with the problems because the vacuum itself is just so incredibly awesome.

title: My beloved irobot
text: I recently upgraded my phone. When I switched I had trouble syncing the new phone to my wifi which meant all my apps requiring wifi were not functioning unfortunately this lasted for 5 weeks! It was the longest most torturous 5 weeks because my iRobot and brava just sadly sat there unable to get to work on my dusty house! The day I heard the lovely little ring sound from my iRobot working again was like my birthday and Christmas combined! May I never have to be without them again!

title: Now I tell my wife... I got this, I’m vacuuming
text: I really mean: we have a Roomba (Fran) with a base station which need to be cleaned once a month, but the little robot cleans hard wood floors every other day & special occasions. She does a great job with dog fur and flour, corn meal, oats from baking in the kitchen. Keep phone cords off the floor! And don’t forget to set your “keep out” zones for floor vents and problem areas for scheduled vacuuming. Frans been taking care of things for two years and going strong. It gives my wife and I more time to spend together!🥂

title: Too many notifications in newest update
text:
As of the newest update I'm getting 3 notifications simultaneously every time the j7 robot completes a scheduled cleaning job -- one telling me the job was completed, one asking me to complete a "quick report card" and one asking me to review obstacle areas. 

Is there no way to combine these into a single notification; moreover, how is the quick report card different from the obstacle review process and why are those separate processes? It's just a lot of notification noise that seems unnecessary. No complaints otherwise.

title: This thing is fascinating
text: I can spend an hour watching the robot without realizing it. Since the robot moved in the house always has a baseline cleanliness that makes our lives seem more orderly. Sometimes the robot gets a bit kooky and runs in circles. It makes me wonder what the programmers were thinking that day but overall it is a welcome member of the family. Oh, it keeps the cats guessing about it too which is good and often funny. If we weren’t home all the time I would get the auto bin emptier.

title: I am super impressed
text: Have had my Roomba I7 with automatic empty feature for a month. There is a bit of a learning curve with Smart Maps but worth the time to do and redo until nearly perfect. I couldn’t be more happy or impressed with this marvelous little wonder! Software updates have been outstanding and customer support easy to reach and very knowledgeable. I am using the vac in a two level home and not having to move the base station at all. The dog is also very entertained by it as am I. Thanks for the great product.

title: Worst app on my phone.
text: What’s less than 1 star? Considering returning vacuum. The vacuum is pretty nice. The app is absolute garbage. The amount of time I spend on this app could be used manually vacuuming the floor, and maybe a couple of my neighbors floors, and I’d have lots of time to spare. text:
I set areas on the house map it creates to places my dog likes to lounge. I just tell the echo, “tell roomba to vacuum shed spots”. Off it goes. I love that it empties itself. That was the one thing about my older roomba I didn’t like. One room would fill it up 3 times with dog hair. text:
Bought a cleaning duo for our house, i7+ and Brava jet M6.  Great machines, good quality, do a great job of daily work.  Love to use the scheduling feature.  Not all the rooms have daily traffic, so not all rooms need to be cleaned everyday!

My only negative comments are something that can be done in a software update. (which they do)

Imprint link is oversold.  It does work, but not in a scheduling situation.  If you just press clean IN THE APP on either device you have the option of the vac telling the mop “I’m done here! Still a great product!  Highly recommend!

title: App 5.2 Has A Bug — Hangs at “Roomba connecting to <network>” FIX IS PROVIDED HERE
text:
App 5.2 Has A Bug — Hangs at “Roomba connecting to <network>”.  Here’s the “workaround” until iRobot app developers fix it.  Encountered in brand new Roomba e5. 

THE PROBLEM
1) Setup works fine until final step of “Roomba connecting to <network>. This may take a while”.

2) Audible voice says something like “Roomba is connected - ready for use”

3) But app is still HANGING at “Roomba connecting to <network>. This may take a while”.

THE FIX
1) KEEP original setup device (FIRST DEVICE) open with the iRobot Home app stuck at “Roomba connecting to <network>. This may take a while” as shown above.  

2) Download iRobot Home app to SECOND device —and LOGIN. The Roomba setup is complete, device is shown all working correctly (app is ready to setup scheduling etc).  SOOooo the problem was NOT your network — the problem is the APP!!

3) Now, go back to FIRST device — and DELETE the iRoomba Home app (yes DELETE it). 

4) Download the iRoomba Home app again and LOGIN. Everything is there — original setup worked fine. The APP has a BUG. 

BOTTOM LINE — it’s NOT your WI-FI — ITS THE APP!!

title: Absolutely Amazing
text:
Rosie (my roomba) is one of the best things I have ever owned! Living in Hawaii, we get lots of dirt and dust throughout the day, but Rosie is always there to clean it up quickly. We have tile throughout the bottom floor and with two cats and a dog that shed and track dirt inside she is always ready to do a quick sweep and make the floors look great. 

The new WiFi bata for the roomba works well too. It has mapped my whole first floor and is pretty spot on with my coverage. Not something I expected to see with a roomba but a nice touch to see where you might have low spots for coverage.

title: Poor Documentation
text:

The app gets a fail from me right off the bat for poor documentation/process flow: Immediately after registration, the app automatically attempts to connect to the robot. The problem is, the robot needs to be on the Home Base to do so, yet the app leaves out this necessary bit of info.

title: Love our Bots!!
text:

title: i7+
text: Men and women definitely have different ideas of cleanliness. This has been a game changer for my wife and I. So far we absolutely love this. My wife feels like this is amazing and is not a tech fan but loves Roomba i7+

title: Bought an I4 from Costco.
text: It does a nice job of cleaning. My only comment is sometimes it says the bin is full when it’s mostly empty. Other times it really full. I think I do a reasonable job of emptying the bin and cleaning the sensors so I don’t know why it isn’t more consistent. It is reassuring to see how much dirt I am removing from the house when I empty the bin.

title: Love the device, but not the app
text:
I receive notifications for everything except bin full alerts. And since I have a dog who sheds constantly, that alert happens a lot. It’s the main reason I would need a notification on my phone. This means I’m going to the Roomba itself to check the light and if the light is on I hit the button on the Roomba to stop it. The previous version of the app would send those alerts but silently, which was annoying but at least I’d get some sort of notice. Not sure why they removed it entirely for this release. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

text:

title: Nothing but Good
text: We’ve had iRobots for years and they’ve worked great. The old units basically bumped their way around the rooms and often got stuck. This new smart version maps the rooms and has never gotten stuck (so far). Plus the self-emptying feature is fantastic. Love it! My only complaint is the cost of the little electronic “walls” to block areas really overpriced- but don’t know of an alternative. We need them in our house to avoid wires and electronics. All in all, a great product!

title: Little Robot does what’s designed for
text:
I am using this little Robot past six months and enjoyed its services. I have both hardwood and carpet in my primary living floor. This machine works well with carpet but not effective only hardwood floor, leaves dirt and small particles behind. Carpet cleaning is good enough especially I have small kids however it’s not pristine clean like other hand held vacuum cleaner. If I ever to change one feature of this machine, I would have reduce the noise it makes while self emptying. My little one is really scared about this noise. 

Overall I’m okay to use this since I have don’t time to clean everyday.

title: Life changing!
text: We have dogs, and we have never been able to keep up with the dog hair and Arizona dust on the tile floors through our house.  Until Roomba. We have him scheduled for a full house clean every day, and our floors have never looked better.  Further, getting all the dust up has improved our problems with allergies.  We have the self-emptying model, and it is just the most amazing appliance we’ve ever had. We’ve already recommended it to several family members and friends.

title: Great updates so far
text:
The updates in the past few months have been great. I would like to see native location usage instead of relying on IFTTT. Should be pretty easy to implement. I would love to for Roomba to vacuum when everyone is gone. I won’t use IFTTT for location data due to bugs.

Time limit functionality needs more options. I love the idea, but it could take roomba 3 charge cycles to clean everywhere. I feel like anything 15 minutes - 6 hours should be good.

title: Great but...
text: I love the roomba it keeps all my floors clean most importantly without me having to sweep hardly ever. But. I just wish I could set it to clean one room. I don’t always need it to clean my entire house maybe just the dinning room or kitchen. It has a camera and keeps a map of my floors anyways so why not allow me to use that data to my advantage instead of me having to buy virtual walls. I know this is probably ridiculous and sounds lazy but what can I say I bought a $800 device so I don’t need to sweep. Also homekit comparability is important. I have the 960 and would recommend it to anyone with tile wood or carpet.

title: Opportunities for improvement
text:
The robot works great most of the time. Occasionally it will get lost and create new areas in the house that don’t exist. When this happens I have to reload an older map. Then I have to set up all my schedules again because reloading the map erases the schedules.
The second thing is that it can’t tell the difference between hard floors and carpet or rugs. This isn’t too big of a deal, but it does keep me from getting the mop robot. I don’t have a pet, but object recognition could be a bigger issue if I did.

title: Roomba  i4
text: This is I think one of the basic Roomba that’s available but unexpectedly, works better than those more expensive and supposedly more high-tech ones. text: The editor for smart mapping is clunky and only wants to show a very zoomed-in view that makes it hard to work with. It’s not very usable. title: Betty is Awesome!
text:

Thank you iRobot for making Betty!!!

title: Pretty happy
text:

text: Most the time I don’t have an issue. But three times since February I have had to redo my map runs because my maps got really wonky. A bunch of triangles is square rooms.  Moved all my room borders around. It couldn’t vacuum my rooms correctly because of it.  It was a tad frustrating because I use roomba daily because of my three very furry dogs. title: Won’t even connect
text: I find it hard to believe that this app has a 4.6 rating when the majority of the comments I read said they have the same problem I’m having: the roomba won’t even connect to the app. It’s very disappointing that their products are so expensive and they made them where you can only schedule cleanings through the app. If I had known the app was faulty, I probably would’ve just bought the model I recently replaced that still had the buttons on the actual robot so I could schedule cleanings that way. I could’ve saved several hundred dollars. This is extremely disappointing. If you’re going to make expensive products, please make an app that actually works.

title: Auto Updates
text:
I love my i7+, however, turn off auto updates with this product. If there’s a glitch in the update, their solution is to wait until a new update comes out. 

Currently, my roomba will only back off the dock and then stop. It’s basically worthless because I updated the app. I sat on the phone for over a hour with a tech specialist, and his final response was it’s a known issue, and I had to wait until a new update comes out. 

I went in to turn off all auto updates so this never happens again. Once this gets fixed, it’ll be the last time I update my roomba.

title: Getting smarter and more capable every day
text: With every update it learns with the new mapping it’s more capable with the cameras it avoids more obstacles. I still need to check in and make sure it has docked correctly or the battery will not be charged for the next cleaning. The mapping system does not allow me to identify room and hallways. It would be really awesome if I could program walkways or hallways because I would like to do an extra cleaningOn the paths most traveled, hopefully with the next update

title: A life changer!
text: Pairing this ap with my 960 series Roomba is nothing short of marvelous! Not sure how we survived without this baby before!
