The ap provides a great deal of information for owners as well as updates on the Robot too. Direct call to customer service if your robot misbehaves. My personal favorite is the virtual map showing exactly where it did clean. Very gratifying indeed.. especially to a clean freak like me. I have two Roombas and have literally sold a dozen to friends. Too bad I don’t get a commission as I think I should! Love my Roombas, love this ap!

title: It’s Nice to Have a Robot Around the House
text: While the iRobot is far from perfect, with the room designation technology, it can get the job done with just a little bit of effort. You’ll need to clear any major obstacles out of the Roomba’s way, and design your furniture layout to make it easier for your Roomba to get around, but everywhere it gets, it vacuums really well. Overall, an improvement over having to do all of the vacuuming yourself. I personally like to have a battery powered portable to get the corners really well after the Roomba is finished.

title: App not working
text: I bought this robot 2 weeks ago. Today, despite checking my connection, restarting my phone, deleting and reinstalling the app, and trying to reinstall the robot; none of it worked. My map won’t load, cleaning options won’t load, and I can’t control any aspect of the robot from the app. Now it is wondering around the house like an imbecile, driving in circles, bumping into things, and not even spraying & mopping, even though I pressed the button for it to clean. Another issue is that while the app loads, it states a “device” is unable to connect...even after trying all of the trouble shooting steps mentioned above.

title: Help!
text: I can’t tell whether or not my iRobot has run or not. I set it to clean. App shows it leaving its home station but a minute later it’s show it’s home, ready to clean. But there’s no history. Show’s last cleaning from several days ago. Remove app, restarted iPhone, then re-installed app. At this point it showed that it was cleaning. But next check showed it was back home, charging but ready to clean. The battery showed about 1/2 full, so it must have run. But still, the job didn’t show up on the history and there were no error messages. So I won’t know if the room is clean or not until I get home. I never had any issues like these with previous app. Worthless. Bring back previous app.

title: Mapping
text: It would be such added feature if you could actually teach Roomba to remember or map certain areas. It would be nice to tell it via Alexa to clean only a certain room. You limit an area, let Roomba clean that area, store the area it just cleaned by giving it a name like TV room or dining room, etc. I am not sure how much memory would be required or if the phone memory would be able to be used. In today’s smart home environment it just doesn’t seem right to pick Roomba up move it the location you want cleaned and put up the electronic barriers. Anyone else feel as I do?

title: Overall Great except:
text:
It is a wonderful machine except that it has a few drawbacks.  First, it can’t clean corners because of its round design (even with the little side brush.  

Second, despite its sensors and being a “smart “ vacuum, it gets stuck under a couple of pieces of furniture.  It pushes itself hard to get under and then can’t get out.  I try to block those areas, but it is an extra time consuming nuisance, and because of the positioning, it ends up blocking portions of my floor that still need to be vacuumed.

Three, the screw for removing the side brush is way too short making it unnecessarily difficult put back on when doing regular maintenance, which I to do weekly.  

Again, overall it is a great vacuum and does a good job of light regular cleaning of my wood floors. I like that it can easily go under my couches and beds, places that are difficult to clean with my regular vacuum.

title: Worked great until 2 days after its first birthday
text:
Ridiculous that my children bought me a vacuum the cost as much as a car for it to completely turn to garbage at one year and one day. I’ve now spent four months trying everything that they’ve suggested and now it won’t even connect at all. 

Is it possible to give zero stars 
I have contacted customer support several times and got no response. Now I just have a very large crappy floor ornament. The worst decision I have ever made was asking for this machine. I’m handicapped and I can’t use a regular vacuum and now my house is just a mess because what my children got me is worthless.

title: Mapping issues
text: I really like my Roomba i7. I have back issues and can’t vacuum my home without severe pain. I’ve noticed since we started using this we don’t have to change our air filters as often. We are slowly changing out our carpets to wood flooring. The carpet was in rough shape and I didn’t want to use the Roomba in those rooms until after changing the flooring. I wish I could edit the mapping. The only way to add rooms is to completely redo the mapping. Please consider adding an editing function to the mapping feature.

title: App Literally Does Nothing... doesn’t work
text:
I have an iPhone 8 and the app won’t get past the open screen to select the country for privacy terms... even worse, I’ve been pushing a customer service convo for over a month trying to get a resolution or refund as this is the main reason to get the latest model roomba. 

Terrible app, even worse customer service. Last note as something humorous, after weeks of “customer service” they released an update to the app specifically for my issue... unfortunately they didn’t even reach out to me for testing or for more details on my issue so... as you guessed it... still not working, and my average response time from customer service is 1 week after I typically have sent several emails.

title: Amazing
text: Perfect for our home and messy pets. Since I couldn’t afford the part that vacuums out the Roomba7  when it’s full. And yes I know there’s the setting to have Roomba stop moving when it’s full; however, I wished there was also an option that would make the Roomba “announce Bin is Full”!!! It’s done that only once and funnily it was when I had flipped it over onto a pillow to remove the side brush to clean out all the hair that gets wrapped around it and that’s when Roomba said “bin is full”

title: Nice way to control the vacuum
text:
For the most part the app is pretty nice and I like the ability to program scheduled cleaning times for our roomba. The feedback for things like bin cleaning and sensor cleaning is also nice and convenient. Our only complaint is that sometimes, the app is slow to load. 
A feature that would be great to have is a service schedule feature like a car. It can tell me when was the last time we replaced the roller brush or the filter and whether replacement time is coming up.

title: Would be great for small spaces
text: IRobot does a fairly good job at daily clean ups. I’ve had to limit the areas it goes into as it’s just too much area for it to clean. It frequently gets stuck under my bed and furniture.  It also has a hard time getting on its base correctly so it doesn’t charge, which is frustrating. It leaves trails on my carpet which is short pile, but does well on my hard floors.  I do like that I can schedule cleanings and for certain areas of my house. It does best when I keep its task to 1-2 rooms per cleaning.I think it would be ideal in a small apartment or loft situation.

title: Not bad but missing features
text:
There should be a feature to:
1- simply click anywhere on the map and select to clean that area, similar to the spot button.
2- to make the robot go home immediately. This is REALLY needed since for instance if the robot can not go to a room because say the door is closed, it will go back home and report an error that requires user intervention. This is ridiculous!!!!  I found no way to solve this from the app BUT  telling Alexa to return the robot home fixes the issue with no handling of the robot. The app should be able to do the same.

title: Works as expected
text: Giving 5 stars but wish there was a feedback section where we could suggest features to add.   I’d like to have the robot or the app play a sound when fully charged so that I can know when to start it.  Maybe it’s just out house but between kids knocking it off the charger or it not always finding its way onto the charging contacts properly, its often dead when I need it, so I have to charge it before using it.

title: Keeps getting better
text: I have a Roomba 960. This is my second. The first drowned in hurricane Harvey. I love the new WiFi mapping feature although the roomba isn’t roaming to my other wireless access point so it reports poor signal when my phone says it’s a great signal.  Cleaning is still very good. Unfortunately I bought this one before the self emptying version was available so I sometimes have to empty the bin during a session. I have a roomba 665 that does upstairs and it’s dumb as a stump compared to the 960. It’ll be upgraded when it dies.

title: App is terrible. Documentation is terrible.
text: Just bought the m6 Braava and tried to connect it to the app which was a complete fail. The documentation provided is inaccurate. I had to go digging online to find the correct instructions to get Bluetooth to work. When it asks you to connect to WiFi you have to disconnect your SSID and reconnect for the Home app to recognize the network. The name of the SSID doesn’t appear where it should in the app. Instead it just shows the wifi symbol. When you try to enter a password for WiFi and press done nothing happens. I’ve gone through their troubleshooting steps listed online and couldn’t get it to work. Tried on the iPad App and same results.

title: App crashes
text:
Everytime i open my app it crashes unless i press several buttons when i 1st open it , some of the time, if it’s the 3rd moon of the 5th sun. 
I was told to contact iRobot support, which i did, twice, a week ago, With no response. I’m also not a fan of the maps .. the map looks nothing like my rooms and I’ve tried rearranging furniture taking up rugs nothing seems to make it map correctly, also with it mapped like a mess spots it gets stuck are hard to pinpoint. Im so far off in mapping that I’ve got a small square and 90% of the room is x’ed off to get it to not get stuck. Also when i tell Alexa to mop and vacuum it always says trouble connecting to Roomba but it always sends the command

title: Liked the old App better
text:
The app does what I need it to do, but I think the layout is terrible. I liked the last layout better (2019?). Starting a job and looking at history and settings was accessible, without having to scroll down through other stuff. 

Maybe the new layout works well for newer robots that can clean specific rooms on command, but I don’t see a poo t to having to create favorites. There’s nothing to customize for my Roomba, so what’s the point?  It would be nice if you could at least customize number of passes and edge cleaning in the favorites.

title: Frustrating App/Robot Combination
text:
After latest updates I’m still not able to delete barriers put up after a mapping run. App just locks up, then force closes every time. 
  I’ve tried two new mapping runs to fix this issue. But after mapping for 9+ hours each time, the robot locks up with an error at the end. Robot reports docking issue, even though it’s in a bedroom not close to the dock. The new mapping run ends up “being corrupted “ and unusable to update the map for areas that were missed on the previous map. 
  I expect a canned reply to this review, but support has been no help in getting this fixed, so what’s the point? Reboot, factory reset?  Doesn’t fix software/firmware problems.

title: Terrible App
text:
Where do I begin.  There are so many features that just don’t work.  I have a 1 year old iPad6 with lots of available memory and I am running OS 13.7.
 
Here are the bugs:
Favorites: 
I can create favorites, BUT, that is all I can do.  I cannot delete them or change them!  There are three dots that appear on the upper right corner of a favorite bar, but, when I tap on it the app closes.
 
Schedules:  
I can create them and I can turn them on and off.  BUT, I cannot delete them.  However, only 1 schedule, the first one I created actually runs.  When I switch on the others, they do no start.
 
Messages:  
When I check out a message there is NO WAY to get back to the App I have to close the app and restart it. 
 
Feedback:  
When you choose “Other (Explain below)” from the “Issue Type” category list.  There is no “Below”. 
 
This App barely performs its basic functions.  This Apps is one of the worst I’ve ever experienced.   Many interactions with iRobot end with we’ll note your problems, but, for now... just live with it.  Really!!!!

title: It doesn’t get any easier
text: Just the best! I have owned an iRobot for over five years now and it just keeps right then picking up all the dog hair, dust, dirt and itsy-bitsy things you can’t even see. It is so nice to be able to have a clean floor every day if you wish or once a week it’s all up to you with their wonderful settings! I will only own their products for the rest of my life! That should tell you enough. Yes, I highly recommend you buy an iRobot today!

title: Love this robot
text:
I have had this robot for about a month now and I can say that I absolutely love it! 
So easy to set up. Intuitive app makes it easy.
It does a great job vacuuming too. I have a pretty big threshold to one room and she gets up over it without an issue. I have an error message happen and the robot even talks to you on how to fix the problem! 
I loved it so much I recently purchased the mopping robot too. Wanda my vacuuming robot now has Wheezy the mopping robot :)

title: My Roomba Rocks!
text: Just got the Roomba about in March. Trial and error with getting mapping done. More user error than anything. I am absolutely loving it. The suction on this is incredible, especially on my carpets and throw rugs. I have a dog that sheds and it was all I could do to keep the floors clean. This Roomba gets into every corner, under chairs and tables...everywhere. Frees me up for other things. Even empties itself! The only question I have is why did I wait so long to get one ! Expensive yes, but worth it.

title: Dog hair crazy!
text: Honestly if your reading this and doing your homework trying to figure out if it clean well or not or whether or not you should buy, just buy it because honestly you love it. I have a golden retriever that sheds a lot and man I could not deal with all the hair untill I got this and 100% no hair on my floor anymore. Ohhh and I come from very traditional Mexican family where I grew up my mom cleaning everyday and man not to talk smack or anything but this things cleans on par with my mom lol! So just buy it!

title: Worthless with a braava 240
text:
I have to reconnect every time I use the machine. The reason being is the memory is wiped every time I take the battery out and you have to take the battery out EVERY time to charge it. Also the machine has to be on in order for the app to work. So if I’m at work and I want to start my braava jet it won’t work because when you push the start button it has to be started within a certain time or it will turn off. You also have to be in range of your machine. 
If I have to push the start button why wouldn’t I just push it a second time while I’m down there instead of having to find my phone and take my time to reconnect and push that start button?
I deleted the app. It’s worthless.

title: Smart vacuum
text: Absolutely loving this vacuum. It does an amazing job and having the wifi ability means I can vacuum my home and time it out that when I get home from work it’s just finished it’s job. Every day about an hour before I come home I start it up and come home to a perfectly clean floor. I empty the container every 3 days and I’m always blown away by how much dirt it picked up. Worth the money when you see the results and don’t have to vacuum yourself.

title: Remote cleaning
text: The app works well for scheduled cleaning. It is more problematic depending on how many potential issues you have. For instance I have throw rugs with fringe which need to be removed before cleaning. The other issue is long electrical cords which need to be elevated before cleaning.  If I have removed these issues, it works great, if not I get a message that my Robot needs attention. It will clean until it gets stuck. If you store things under your furniture such as a bed or sofa, it may also cause a problem.

title: Works Great!
text: The app is very easy to use for controlling the robot, setting schedules & seeing your cleaning map (i3). Occasionally the status will show as “not connected” but if you simply wait a few seconds it always reconnects, so I don’t really see that as an issue. It is constantly moving around the house, so spotty WiFi is to be expected. It doesn’t affect the functionality of the robot. I’ve been very happy with the app and upgrading from my old Roomba to the i3.

title: Love, love, love
text: We had to vacuum our house at least two times per day due to the amount ofDirt and hair are children and animals seem to bring into the house. Since we purchased this iRobot, I have not vacuumed once! We have had it for over two months now and it is doing a fabulous job. It is so wonderful that if for some reason it broke tomorrow I would purchase another one immediately. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this product.

title: Great product
text:
I’ve been running roomba 960 for about 5 years once a week, picking up cat hair and litter for three cats.  Hardly ever gets stuck and the maintenance costs are low.  But my house is a mix of hardwood and tile floors.  Can’t  do carpet with the cats.

Over the years I’ve replaced the battery, extractors, brush assembly and front wheel.  Very easy to do.  Just need a few screwdrivers.  

Pair it were it’s a cordless vacuum and it makes life a lot easier than dragging the heavy canister around.

title: Love the vacuum but struggles to run scheduled programs
text: The vacuum and app are both great....When they work that is. I run a scheduled program 4 mornings a week, in different rooms each day. 2 out of 4 days at minimum, the vacuum cancels itself before completing the program leaving half the programmed rooms not vacuumed.  It also will not empty its bin about half of the time, requiring manual emptying. Programmable schedules and self emptying were the features that I thought made this upgraded model worth the extra money, now I’m not so sure.  These problems  started about a year after owning the unit. Disappointing.

title: Nicely improving
text: The app functions very well for most people. It’s clean simple and intuitive. With the recent additions of cleaning zones and no go zones the app has greatly improved. Just goes to show that Roomba is committed to improving their products. It looks like some people are having small issues that may turn out to be more user error than app error. I myself had a problem with the app being completely wiped from floorplans to schedules but the next day all of it was back. Strange but I’m happy it’s back.

title: My little helper
text:
I’m very pleased with Brava Jet. I use it to spot check/clean in between my deep cleaning Jobs which I do because I have grout. I can only imagine how easy my life would be if I didn’t have grout or thin grout lines like my daughter has (she loves it too!). The mapping Technology Is the best. I can name the rooms schedule certain rooms for different days love it.

I have Brava Jet and 2 Roombas one upstairs and one downstairs this app really helps because I can name them I make different schedules.

title: Love my Robo
text:
I have my robo on a daily schedule.  We have a German Shepard and he can easily shed a new dog daily!!!  The shedding is out of control so my Rumba  is used for that main purpose and what a fantastic job it does!!!  If I didn’t have it I would definitely be vacuuming every day myself.
What wonderful technology....I’ve reordered the bags...brushes and side brushes and have been very satisfied with everything.  Customer Service has been very helpful the one time I needed a question answered.

title: Why didn’t I know sooner?
text:
Firstly, I was the most skeptical person of this little machine.  After “James” has worked for me now for a while, I’m not sure how I ever lived without his services!
He does a better job than I do.
I still feel like someone comes in at night and dirties my floors intentionally because the thought of living with all that he picks up on a daily basis, considering I only vacuumed twice weekly is appalling!
Do yourself a favor and invest.  You won’t be sorry!! This is the best appliance in my now clean home!!

title: Mostly love it
text: I mostly love my roomba and the app. There’s been a few oopsies on our part as owners such as a dog “going” on the floor and the roomba was running before we realized it and well we had a mess on our hands. When it comes to the iRobot app, the only thing I wish was better is it seems to be “unable to connect” quite often which can be frustrating but overall I recommend both the product and the app to others. It’s certainly saved my sanity with two German shepherds and two cats.

title: Worked Great for 12 Months - Now Very Erratic Performance...Do not buy!
text:
I don’t know if it is the app or the machine, but after 18 months my Roomba I-7 is barely functional. I am diligent about maintenance however it constantly is telling me to clean the contacts and the Home Base window. It also fails to clean its bin, saying bin sensors are dirty. They are not dirty. The app used to have an “Empty Bin” button for manually activating the Clean Base. This button no longer appears on the app dashboard. 
It is very frustrating that for $1,200 this machine, which worked very well for about 12 months, has so miserably failed to function. 
Definitely recommend against buying until these longevity issues can be fixed.

title: Can not switch accounts in app or allow more than one user to control the robot.
text:
Although the app improved with the new braava jet m6 but it now only allows only one user account to control a robot. This is a failed assumption, normally there are more than one person in a household. There’s no way to switch accounts except when trying to add a robot that is first paired by another phone.
A suggestion is to have a link to allow switch accounts.
Another way is allow setting up sharing with authorized users.
Please update the app as soon as possible. Or, I would suggest to take out one more star.

title: Editing issues
text:
We have had the iRobot 8 for several weeks and the app seems a bit flakey. We have the app installed on our iPad and iPhone and have the same issues on both. If you want to edit or delete a schedule, clicking on the pencil in the upper left of the schedule box simply closes the app all together. 
The only way I have found around this is to turn off the event and make a new one. 
The app also shows the iRobot as “not connected” all the time when it really is. The iRobot’s is super close to the router so I’m not sure what to make of that.

title: App crashes when trying to change room borders
text:
Please fix the bug which occurs when trying to edit room borders. My app completely freezes and then crashes, and I end up having to 1) delete the smartmap and 2) redo multiple training runs which takes forever. Please contact me so that I may help you submit a bug report if you need. I will change to five stars once this is fixed because this is literally the only thing I am unhappy about with this app. Everything else works flawlessly (scheduling, notifications about roomba cleaning progress or bin status, etc)

The robot itself works great - this review is concerning the flawed room border adjustment in the app

title: Where has this been my whole life???
text: I was super skeptical of this machine. I thought there was no way it would have the sucking power as my Dyson V11 animal vacuum. This has saved me so much time. It leaves zero dirt behind. It runs beautifully and the battery has a pretty good life. I love how it empties itself. It is very self sufficient. I wish I had gotten it years ago. Our house is about 4,200 sq ft and it usually takes 8 hours to vacuum/charge the entire thing.

title: Plagued with problems
text:
The Roomba constantly loses Internet connection, frequently needs to be rebooted, and often simply won’t reboot. We have had to start from scratch numerous times and customer service has not solved the problems.

The actual cleaning is mediocre. The rumba is in capable of vacuuming hair or crumbs on rugs. It will vacuum repeatedly over the same area while missing others. There is nothing systematic about its routing. If there is a way to instruct it to vacuum a particular room only without physically bringing it there, we have not found it

Overall, it falls far short of the manufacturers promises and our expectations.

title: Well designed app with sensible options
text: The hardware is great, and has been for five years. The app also has sensible options. I enjoy the ability to choose either deep clean or single pass. We now have a dog, and with all of the hair, I’d rather do the whole house once, but multiple times a week rather than a super clean on one day which would then take too long to make it to the all of the rooms. 800 square feet of cleaning in one floor.

title: Works great, no issues, seamless configuration!
text: I own a Roomba 960 and a 980. I had absolutely no problems setting up these two units. The app works perfectly. I do not understand how anybody could've had any problems with this configuration. I found it very easy and seamless. When I spoke with customer service to inquire about the scope of the warranty, they were extremely professional and courteous, truly among the very best customer support operations that I've ever encountered.

title: I was skeptical
text: I really wanted the iRobot to work for us. We have plenty of pet hair, I left the box sit on the fireplace hearth for two weeks. Once we got our “cookie” on a regular schedule it has been amazing. The bin emptying is such a great feature. Needless to say, the box is gone and cookie is a part of our family, the dog and cats have adjusted well. What a wonderful feeling it is to come home and it feels like the cleaning crew that Covid interrupted was back. So glad we took our sons advice.

title: Awesome little helper
text: 6 months and no problems, it’s a really great sweeper, set it to run every other day and use your dyson or broom once a week. It’s does a good job but corners and some other areas it just can’t get to. It really does save you from having to sweep several times a week. We Let it take care of the floors during the week and on Saturday we will usually give it a good vacuum with our Dyson and then gave the floors and mopping. Have no regrets for buying it.

title: Roomba
text:
So disappointed with this updated app. It does not recognize my WiFi. No matter how many times I redo the app. So I went to factory reset.  And I can get nowhere. I have deleted and reopened app to no avail. Now all I get is “robot not found “ very very disappointed. Please find and fix the problem or at least more than one option on app available for iRobot

After several days of taking off app and re applying. Today the app connected to my roomba. 🙂

title: What’s up with Wifi connectivity?
text: Just unboxed a brand new i3+. Went through the setup process multiple times. The robot told me it was connected but the app said it wasn’t and would not allow me to proceed. Sat on hold on the phone waiting for tech support for 40 minutes while I tried everything. Eventually, I tried accessing my 2.4g network rather than the 5g. Connected right up. At this price, why does it not function with 5g?? And why not at least put that little tidbit in the initial instructions to save a lot of headache. I’ll try it far a while and see if I come back for a change of stars or not..,

title: Does a great job
text: The instruction manual left a lot to be desired; just be patient and do a mapping run a couple of times.  After 2 weeks I have my floor plan mapped, my rooms labeled and my oriental carpet marked as a clean area.  The Robot has not damaged this expensive carpet and it finally looks as clean as when it was new (all dog hair has been removed).  “Hilda” has cut my cleaning time in half: I de-clutter and dust while it sweeps.  It does a great job of keeping my floors looking like the cleaning lady just left.

title: Apple Watch app please!!
text: I love my roomba. I just let it run while I’m home and it helps with the cat hair and dust so much! My only qualm with the app is that it doesn’t have an Apple Watch version. I would love to see one because when I’m home I don’t keep my phone on me. This means that if the roomba is in distress I have to physically hear it beep so I can unstick it. With an app for the Watch I could receive notifications on my wrist, and start and stop it from my wrist, including giving it the dock command. It seems silly, but it would make a great experience even better!

title: Underdeveloped App
text:
I have been using Roomba I-7 and Braavo Mop for more than 18 months. However, the app has been giving me so much trouble logging in. Every time the app is updated, it will log me out and neither allow back log in nor allow reset password. For last 3 days I am unable to use these machines. 

Last time called customer care, they took 3 days and could not figure out what’s wrong with account. However, I myself figured out the issue. This time that too not working. Wasted so much of time. Don’t feel like talking to customer care because I know they will take he’ll lot of time to figure out what has been the issue. Feel so helpless and pathetic 😞

title: NOT THAT SMART Ai
text: The user interface is in need of improvement. Also the application needs to be able to re-discover rooms because it has forgotten half of a room that it already mapped. It will not return to that area and will not re-discover it. The app is also very cryptic on its communications when there are issues or when it gets trapped under furniture and can’t figure out how to get out. The battery dies and then you have to figure out where it is. The bottom line, the software needs to be a lot smarter and a lot more user-friendly

title: Good machine to help out
text: Had it for around a year, use it regularly and it does quite well! I prep the room like tucking cords in, moving clothes or objects off the floor so it can do it’s thing without issues. The downsides are that the filters need replaced pretty frequently. I’d love a filter I could wash instead of generate trash. The small bin size is ok for me since I’m around to dump it as needed. I will still vacuum the tough spots- between a rug, wood floor and kitchen tiles since a piece of moulding prevents good suction there. I’ve found it helpful overall.

title: IRoomba Vacuum
text: My vacuum no longer recharges fully between heading out to the various parts of the home. Sometimes instead of returning to recharge it just runs out of juice and I have to carry it back to home base to recharge! Then, it thinks it’s done, and gives me the end of job signal. Then once it recharges, I have to carry it down to the far end of house and close the door so it will stay vacuuming the last two rooms. I think it only worked right a couple of times in a year and a half. It was a gift so I continue to use it weekly. Needs improvement.

title: $900?! Yes, and worth it.
text: Bought the 980 because of positive feedback about Roamba from friends and online and the 980s power in particular. Was doubting myself when checking out because of how expensive it is but after 2 weeks I can’t deny it works like a charm. Hits the edges and corners and goes under, over and around intuitively. If you have extra time to spare don’t bother but if you have limited spare time due to family, other activities pull the trigger you won’t be disappointed.

title: App says I’m not online yet I clearly am
text:
On my S-9 I set it to clean at high power in settings but next time it goes out it reverts to the medium setting. I bought this thing so I could have the high level cleaning....also I used to be able to set it to do a light cleaning of certain rooms on certain days and a detailed clean on other days and now I can not do that plus it keeps reverting to the middle custom setting. 

iRobot sent another one and it's doing the same thing. I'm not going through anymore with irobot but this thing worked perfectly till summer when you screwed up the app and made it so I could not use the robot the way it was advertised to work. I was assured a work around would be rolled out for this but it's been this way since I think July. 

I've had iRobot products for at least 15 years, probably a dozen or more in all. This is the first time I feel like Irobot has taken a great product and made it worse. What is the point of having the high power vac if I can't use it on that setting. 

FIX IT

title: Dust bunny extinction
text: Our Roomba 960 is perfect. We named him Floyd.  He goes from hard woods, to area rugs, to wall-to-wall carpet and to tile with ease.  No kamikaze dives off the stairs or ledges.  Dust bunnies are extinct, especially under our beds.  Only trace of our chocolate lab is the actual lab and not her fur.  Floyd is a great addition to our family.  His clean-up maps of rooms are great too.  WiFi lets him start when we are gone and he tells us when he is done.  Don’t go for substitutes.  Get your own Floyd, who will bravely go to the dark sides of your rooms.

title: My home
text: I received my IRibot for Christmas 2020. I use it in my open floor plan 2450 square ft apartment with both carpet and hard floors, I have no children left at home but do have a cat and a husband ( not sure which is messier)I have it programmed to vacuum three days a week and WOW what a difference in how clean my floors stay!!!!! I love it and would be heartbroken if I needed to ouch a vacuum around again! My Christmas list for this year only has on thing on it , an IRobot mopping system !!!!

title: Amazing technology
text: Given my degree and 40 years of experience working with advanced technology, including autonomous flight systems, this software and associated hardware (robot) system are some of the most impressive technology I have seen. Extremely easy to use and gets the job done. There are a few features I would like to see, like allowing remapping a room without having to create a new total map, but the features it does have work extremely well.

title: These reviews made me change my mind
text:
We just bought an i7 but after reading these reviews we decided to return it and buy a different brand. We don’t want to open the box and not be able to return it if it won’t work correctly because of the app. Wish we had read the app reviews before buying it. We shared these reviews with a few friends who were considering buying one and they changed their minds on getting a Roomba now.
Update: We returned the vacuum because the point was to have a working app to utilize all of the features. If I just wanted to turn it on and let it bounce it’s way around my house, I would have bought a much cheaper vacuum.

title: Needs some improvements
text:
Got my i7 and after mapping the entire house which took two days, it started making a noise and had to replace it. The map cannot be transferred, really disappointing.
The new roomba maps the entrance of my house, the hallway on the right and the guest bedroom as a single room.
Tried to run training for two days in a row and cleaning and got the same issue. 
Had to delete the map and now I’ll have to map the house all over again. That is frustrating and simple to fix if I could have copied the first map in the first place.

title: My favorite new family member!
text: Our new Roomba, Jaco, is my new favorite family member. I’ll tell ya, it works hard and is tenacious with his cleaning! Get everything cleaned great and even under beds and spots we can’t get to. We got it because we have two cats and I was vacuuming every couple of days. I haven’t vacuumed in two weeks (since we got Jaco) and I think our monthly housekeeper is nervous we won’t need her anymore! Now if I could just teach him to cook…

title: Fantastic product
text:
It is a real good product. Does it job to perfection.
It does take a while to set it up, but once it maps the entire home, it works great. 
App is very easy to use, maps provide ways to customize rooms, dividers. 
Once setup, very easy to setup a job to clean a specific room. It keeps updating the maps frequently as it cleans, which is just awesome.

The ending of a job is just fun to watch where it just runs along the edges of the entire room and goes to the dock!!

Have to maintain the robot once in 2-3 weeks by cleaning the brush, filter etc.

Of course a recent update caused a bit of a pain of re-mapping but being someone in a similar industry, I understand the issues.

We are very happy, don’t have to drag around a vacuum anymore and spend hours on cleaning.

title: Great helper in my routine cleaning
Not as great as I’d hoped
text: This vacuum seems more novelty than actual useful product. I spend more time figuring out why it has paused a job, not finished a job, trying to get it to recharge while on its port, programming it to do parts of the  house instead of the whole house, and picking up clumps of dog hair it has left behind, than I spend just vacuuming the floor with one of those fuller brush sweeper things.   I may return this vacuum and use the money to buy something I actually enjoy or that actually saves me time and work.  It only got two stars because I can choose its name. Otherwise I would have given it one star.

title: Major Improvement
text: This app has a beautiful interface. It includes several new feature and the animated graphics make the app fun to use. My only criticism is there are many selections to be made to create a Schedule. It used to be all on one page but I’m getting used to navigating through the selections. This app makes setting up and programming my robots a joyful experience! I’m excited to see what the future holds for my big helpers.

title: Most recent update 5.4 fixed crash issue.
text: Had an issue of not being able to edit a favorite routine because it would crash. iRobot contacted me a few days after emailing them to uninstall-install and/or factory reset. I previously did do an uninstall-install which didn’t resolve the issue and I didn’t want to do a factory reset because I didn’t want to lose my historical data. Decided to just wait for an update which I did and it looks like it fixed the issue.

title: Many Issues
text: My iRobot has a lot of issues! When cleaning under cabinets it lifts up and gets stuck. I move it and it goes right back and same thing happens. Some days it can’t find the base unit and dies right in front of it or in the hallway. Sometimes it gets confused and just returns to the base.  Once a week or so I get out my shark vacuum and go over areas it doesn’t clean.  I have a large house and also have a roomba D4 that cleans half of my house. My only issues with it are it won’t empty itself and I can’t tell it which rooms to clean on certain days.  Will probably get another roomba once they evolve and mine wears out.

title: Started good...they did an update and constantly crashes
text:
I bought the i7 with base in May 2020. It worked great until either the iPhone or iRobot app did an update...not my phone MUST be connected to the WiFi to use the app, MUST have location services on, and MUST be connected to cellular data to work...which is crap. I now have to try and connect multiple times, killing off and restarting the app in order to connect and select rooms to clean. It’s frustrating and inefficient. 

If this was all required when I purchased it in May, I would’ve went with a different brand. Get your crap together iRobot.

title: Interactive Opportunity
text: Strange request. I can’t have a typical furry pet but I can have a roomba. I adore my roomba. She works so hard and is always ready to make my carpet so perfect feeling under my toes! Is there any way that y’all could make it more interactive for people who opt into it? She could send me more personalized messages that says she needs to be emptied or I could tell her thank you? I know it’s weird but if we have their birthdays and we get to name them couldn’t we have an interactive option?

title: My secret maid
text: The roomba so much better than I thought it would be!  My husband wanted to get one for us for several years and I did not go along. Last November we Purchased one and it has exceeded my expectations.  It is very smart about moving about the room and getting under things (sometimes it will get stuck under the couch) but my house is better vacuumed now than it ever has been.  I feel like I have an extra hand around the house and I call it my secret maid!  What an invention!

title: My Vacuum
text: 100% the best purchase ever. however this app is spectacular, it lets you select what room to vacuum and even set a schedule! definitely would recommend not using the schedule especially if you have pets (due to accidents or puke) and just to run it during the day. overall it has a great layout and easy to use even for technology challenged people! walks you through everything and pretty basic. love it!!

title: App needs work
text:
The vacuum is great, but the app needs work. I had my room a for two weeks. Tried to open the app today and was greeted with an empty logon screen. Whaaat? This is my phone and my robot! I just want to start a cleaning job, and not to fill in passwords. I don’t remember which email account I used to configure the roomba, and no clue for a password.

If the robot makes a map if every room in my house, why can’t I name rooms on the map and tell it to clean a room XYZ?

When roomba  gets stuck alarm/error icons in the app are tiny, font is small. You have the space - please make the messages easier to read.

title: Cons outweigh the pros
text: First, you have to create and account and give an email address just to use the app. No excuse for that. Second, the privacy info reveals they want info they don’t need, such as contact info.  Why do I need to send contact info to China just to vacuum my floor? Last, the app drains your device’s battery even when the app isn’t open? Why does Apple allow such low quality apps in its store?  It’s really sad to see Apple in decline like this.   Deleted app and recommend you avoid it. On the plus side, it is free as far as paying money for it.  Never did see the interface because I refuse to “log in” or “sign up” just to use a vacuum cleaner app.  Very sad.

title: Why Don't App Developers Listen??
text:
This review and rating is for the app, not the iRobot vacuum.

Immediate forced updates are absurd!  Give a choice as to update later / when.  When I connect to the app to vacuum or change something, I don't want to immediately be greeting with a forced update before I can run the app.  Further, I never chose to run dot zero releases in general since they are notorious for having bugs that weren't discovered during beta testing.

Further, long standing requests and suggestions seem to go unheeded.  Why or why, can't you folks modify the app to work on the iPad in landscape mode?  I do 95% of my workin on my iPad in horizontal orientation, not vertical.  This has been asked and requested for months, if not yrs!

Developers - you could listen to the users, rather than doing things you *think* we should want.

Ability to see where the robot is presently on the map would be great!

Ok, done wishing and hoping for seeing requested app improvements.  Can you at least STOP WITH THE FORCED IMMEDIATE UPDATES!?

title: I Robot
text: My wife and I are very pleased and amazed at the cleaning efficiency, ease of use and the mapping ability that allows a focused area to be cleaned. We look forward the future models that can go up the stairs and clean the second floor of our home as well. Also we wish the battery lasted a bit longer so that the entire first floor is covered with one charge. Definitely worth the investment and would certainly buy again.

title: Love my iRobot!
text: Our iRobot, Floor-ance, has been a great asset to our home! Less dog hair and dirt on the floor. We cannot believe all that is actually there when we clean out her bin. There are always tweaks we have to make to the map when she gets stuck or getting hair from her gears. But that is a small price to pay. And the app makes it easy to change her map zones and warn when she is having trouble or her bin needs to be emptied. Highly recommend!!

title: Amazing Vacuum, Terrible app and execution
text: I absolutely love having the robot to do the vacuuming and it does it’s job well. However, what I cannot stand is the fact that the app continually deletes my favorites and schedules. It is extremely frustrating and seems like something the developers should be able to figure out. This needs to be corrected ASAP especially given how many people are complaining about the same thing. Also, it seems the more the robot runs the worse it makes the maps. Connecting rooms that are not connected etc… while it’s nice to not have to worry about vacuuming I sure do spend a lot of time messing around with the app.

title: Easy life
text: Love this machine.   I have an 880 sq ft condo with all hardwood floors.  It takes 55 minutes to clean the whole place.  It is fairly noisy so I just set it to start as I go out the door to run errands.   All done when I return. One time I forgot to start it before I left.  No problem- I was able to start it with my iPhone app while I was at the hairdresser getting my hair cut.  Isn’t technology great!!!   This machine does a great job and is definitely worth the money.

title: Takes a very long time to clean the house
text:
While I really like the convenience of a robot vacuum, the fact that it has to go back to the home base to recharge so often in a relatively small home in a con. It takes too long to clean the house sometimes up to three hours for this to do its job.

Also, having to pick up every rug in the house and every cord off the floor is inconvenient. Roomba get stuck on the cords too easily, it should have some kind of sensor to go over those or ignore them.  It eats my runners and  doormats,  it has ruined two of them 😪

title: Works Great
text: My Roomba works excellent and is indeed a life saving if you like a day to day cleaning. The dust on the carpet is much less and we can feel the difference if we don't use for a day or two. The App is not bad at all but I agree with one of the previous feedback already given why don't include the compatibility with iOS Home App? Other than that I love the fact that I can start my Roomba when I am not home just using the App or before going out using a voice command with Alexa.

title: Robbie’s Review
text: I’m very happy with most of Robbie’s work. The only drawback is that we have a Golden Retriever who sheds a lot, mostly in the family room! Robbie isn’t often able to clean up all the hair even though he vacuums the family room every day. But the hair is twisted together in several areas on the carpet so it’s easy to spot-vacuum those areas. We didn’t always vacuum everyday but we schedule Robbie daily resulting in a consistently cleaner carpet.

title: Good stuff
text: The app in the unit have been working pretty good for me so far and doing the job, it’s just a few times that I’ve forgotten to close some bedroom doors when I and when I leave I had it set to automatically start when I leave and it winds up getting stuck ha ha so maybe I’ll just switch it to more like a manual mode where I can start it myself when I’m away from home. But my compliment is that it’s very customizable!

title: Intelligent iRobot
text:
Excellent improvement over last 2 years that it does not get stuck anymore and finds its way back to base. It cleans pretty good like my hard wood floor feels sticky in the morning as i walk.
Helped me and my wife with some extra time from cleaning and my boys are also able to use it as needed with google mini speaker. But, remember that it works well(less nice) with the original parts when replacing brushes etc..

title: iRobot Sally
text: She has had her moments where she would get stuck under furniture and finally get out then run out of juice before she would get home.  I think I solved this problem. I haven’t found her dead in any strange places lately. Other than that she does a very good job of doing what I schedule her to do and getting back to base. You do need to keep her off deep shag carpet, it will mess her up. This is the best present I ever gave myself ever! It frees me of the time I would spend sweeping my floors of my 2500sq ft house. 👍😃😁

title: Map feature doesn’t work
text: I set up was initially hard, but after that I could easily set up and change my cleaning schedule. I wish there was a way to just cancel today’s or tomorrow’s scheduling vacuuming without deleting “every Tuesday” and needing to go back in and re adjust later. Would also be nice to be able to say vacuum every x days instead of picking certain days of the week.  My map feature has never worked on the app, which is an item I was looking forward to. So that’s disappointing. Thanks overall this iRobot is much improved from my last one.

title: Rosie Rocks!!
text:
I love my Roomba! Having grown up
watching the Jetsons, I always loved the idea of having a robot maid, and found it fitting to name mine Rosie!... let’s just say, she is a huge time saver, and it is super nice to come home to clean floors. Especially living on a farm, with lots of dust and dirt, and 2 indoor cats. It’s always amazing to see all of the fine particles dirt and cat hair captured in her bin. Thanks you  I-Robot!!... I’ll be a customer for life! Customer since 2016, & still on original battery!

title: Length of cleaning cycle
text: Overall, a user friendly app. However, there are a couple things I would like to change. In the scroll box that allows the user to choose the length of time Roomba will clean for in any given job, I am unable to scroll past 45 minutes. I am sure there are longer options, but the scroll box will not show the options with a longer duration. It would also be nice to have the ability to select the duration of scheduled cleanings rather than defaulted to “everything”.

title: iRobot is not working as it described in their advertisements
text:
The produced map was originally correct when it is brand new! However, less than a month, the generated map was incorrect and cannot automatically clean the entire floor as described in their advertisement.

Contact the customer service for assistance, the customer service representative is nice and ask me to send the robot back for inspection. The technical representative told me that the robot has no issue and shipped it back to me. 

When receiving the robot, the map issue still remains unresolved, and thus, cannot clean the entire floor. Further, it has a new issue. The bumper seems to be not correctly installed and frequently get stuck. The stuck bumper will stop the working robot. Once the robot was even stopped under my bed, which caused a lot of trouble for me to take it out.

I was originally a iRobot fan and have purchased 4 robots in the past. This unpleasant experience will make me away from iRobot and will not recommend it to anyone!

title: I love my Roomba
text: I named my Roomba Rosie, after the housekeeper on the Jetson’s. I’ve had it for two plus years and just replaced the battery for the first time. I’ve loved it. I have a new puppy, and he’s always bringing dirt in from outside.  The convenience of starting Rosie, then taking Rip for a walk is fabulous. It does a very good job. I haven’t had issues with it getting stuck. Easy to clean. Between Rosie and my new handy dandy sweeper I don’t vacuum nearly as often.

title: Working great for me
text: I have a Roomba 960 and so far there have been no issues with this app update. My robot is working great and never has an issue cleaning or getting back to it’s home base. The only thing I can’t figure out is how to label different rooms. It may be that the model I have doesn’t support this but as far as cleaning it manages to clean our first floor of 415 sq feet (hardwoods, rugs, and tile with a hefty threshold to clear) in about an hour. Highly recommend.

title: Was perfect til app update
text: I loved my roomba and brava robots for several months. Had schedules set up and the bots diligently followed them with fabulous success. Then the app was updated. First brava started crashing every time I opened the History screen. It wasn’t ever finishing a job but I couldn’t find out why or what it had completed. I messaged support and got no help. Now this week it has dropped the capability to run the vacuum as well. Trying to see history just hangs with a rotating wheel and voice commands no longer work. Pretty useless for a couple of very expensive items. I was recommending these models to everyone who asked me how I keep my floors so clean... now, not so much.

title: Awesome vacuums
text: If you don't have an i7 plus or a S9 plus you should definitely buy one. They are awesome! The S9 plus is better, higher suction better design, larger filter, d head and shorter cleaning run times most like because of a larger battery but the i7 is very capable as well. The auto empty bin is the game changer here and even with a shedding dog the bag only needs to be emptied every 6 months or so. I can't say enough good things about iRobot and the roombas.

title: Help!
text:
Love my Roomba’s, but seems to need my help a lot! Always seems to get stuck under chairs and the sofa. Also, could you make the dirt bin bigger on the actual Roomba? Always heading back to get emptied. We have two large dogs, four cats and two young children. The Roomba has trouble keeping up with our active life. 
A little work in the AI department would help the unit to learn the same obstacles, so as to avoid them in the future. 
Over all, been a fan for about 20 years. Helps my wife keep up with the family. Still, needs work.

title: Bad
text: It doesn’t work half the time and when it does it has issues. It worked great when I first got it, which makes me think they are just screwing with us to try to force people to upgrade their robots. After paying so much money for this robot vacuum, you’d think it would be better and more reliable than this. I’m disabled, so I need something that can help me with my daily cleaning. This robot and app are almost more work than a regular vacuum. The app itself says it can’t connect more often than not and then it sends the vacuum on weird routes to places I told it not to go.

title: After app update it wont clean under the bed!
text:
I don’t understand why more people aren’t complaining about this. All our prevous irobot model and in fact this model (the i7!!!!!!!!!!!) used to clean properly under the bed. Might i add that cleaning inaccessible areas like this is what made us purchase irobot products in the first place. Now, it will never clean there UNLESS I specifically make it go back to a newly added “clean area”. When it is tasked to coean the bedroom it will clean along the walls and the entrance mainly, creating literall dust bunnies under the bed (I know, super gross).
I’m guessing it’s because its a little bit darker? Might i add this is with full sun ceiling to floor sun facing windows.
FIX THIS PLEASEEEE!

title: Roomba
text: We love the roomba. Did not give it a 5 star because it does not go into a room and complete the entire job while it is there. It does part of it and returns several times to get the entire room cleaned. . By the time it is done with a room it has swept the entire room in two different directions, under whatever furniture it can get under, closet floors if the door is left open and all around the edges. Would not take so long to do a room it it did it all before going to another room.  Other than that, we love it.

title: Best purchase ever
text: I have 2 fur babies that both shed. After years of dealing with trying to keep hair cleaned up in my house, I decided to purchase the iRobot. This has been one of the best investments that I have ever made. It took about two weeks for Sasha to learn my house and now I can send her to anywhere in my house to clean. She’s very thorough, and the the dog hair is totally under control. I would recommend the iRobot to anyone with shedding fur babies!

title: Simple and elegant but crashes
text: This is a useful app for making the most of Roomba. It lets you do all the basic maintenance and mapping, and displays a nice view of the home with rooms and areas you’ve named and defined. My issue is that the “...” settings menus crash every single time. For most functions there is another way to access the settings, but for Favorite routines I can only modify by deleting the routine and starting over.

title: Life Changing!
text: I love my Roomba! It makes me less stressed about messes (kids, em I right?) because I know I can just send my Roomba out to take care of of them. One major suggestion I have for improvement is to have child lock features...kids cannot resist that big, flashing “clean” button. I know friends who have avoided getting one because they know their kids would not leave it alone. We survive and, overall I still love my ‘bot, but this would make my life even easier.

title: Works decent
text: Overall I really enjoy it. It does a decent job. It does miss stuff and it doesn’t use a smart pattern so explains why it misses things. It will be going into a room and will take a direction but it won’t go all the way to the wall sometimes and originally I figured it would go around the walls at the end for cleanup but it doesn’t. So I wish they programmed it that once it learns a room and maps it, to develop a pattern that makes sense and isn’t changing up to miss spots.

title: Worse after update
text: Terrible since update. I found my room dividers in my map all skewed and messed up. When I deleted one to arrange it correctly....that’s where I screwed up. Now the app force closes any time I try and do any update to my map. The map is now all screwed up because I can’t edit it. I’m not gonna remap it either because I’ve seen the other reviews saying it’s screwed them ip worse by doing so.

title: Shedding Dogs Best Friend
text: Theo only weighs ten pounds but he seems to shed his weight in dog hair each week. Our i7plus is outstanding at picking up our dog's hair. We love that we can schedule more frequent cleaning in just the rooms where he plays the most.  And we were pleasantly surprised that our Roomba even suggested an area that we had overlooked that could use a little more attention.  So it's a toss up of whether the dog or the Roomba is truly man's best friend.

title: New update flawed
text: I have always loved my vacuum and the app. The new update has given me nothing but problems. I gave it some time and figured it was just me and change but it hasn’t gotten better. The app keeps changing the map and making it hard to clean the areas I want, it also no longer has the function to do an occasional deep clean w ease. I have to change the settings and then remember to change them back before the next run. As of today my app will no longer loads. It says my phone is not connected to the internet but it is. Even when I switch over to my carrier data it gives the same response.

title: Best ever!
text: My floors look great thanks to Cynthia!  She does an amazing job cleaning my 2000sq ft hard wood and carpeted floors. My kids or pets move chairs or leave toys everywhere, and she does a great job of vacuuming around them.  She has gotten stuck a few times, but with the app installed on my phone- I get an alert to let me know there is a problem!  This is my first robot vacuum- it’s well worth the money not to have to vacuum manually.  Amazing device!

title: Cleans Fantastic
text: Honestly, I am highly impressed with how well it cleans; we have three dogs, and one sheds a lot. It picks up so much dirt and hair in just one cleaning I’m shocked every time I empty the bin. But on the other hand, every time I want to use it, it takes at least 15 minutes to reset it and reconnect it to either my cell phone or my Google Home. Sometimes I pick up the mess by hand or grab a classic upright vacuum cleaner. It could be very frustrating sometimes, especially when you have company coming over and crunched on time.

title: Great!
text: Does a great job at maintaining a dust free floor! I have tile floor throughout my home with rugs placed here and there. It can vacuum all rugs except my thick shag rug, which of course is expected. I have to get the big vacuum out so I can clean well where the end of the rug meets the floor because dirt gets out of the roomba’s reach when the dirt gets tucked under the edges of the rug. But roomba is certainly a time-saver for me to use throughout each week! I have a schedule where each room gets vacuumed at least once a week!

title: App crashes on multiple devices
text:
UPDATE.  Emailed iRobot a couple weeks ago and no response. I love having three expensive devices in my house I can’t control. Sending them back. Perfectly good units that do a good job made worthless by a bad app. 

The app worked perfectly when I first purchased my Roomba and Brava Jet.  After about two months the app started crashing immediately upon opening.  I tried everything, reinstallation, changing setting, etc.  nothing would fix it.  I have since loaded the app on my wife’s phone, my kids phones and even my iPad Pro.  All crash upon opening.  Without the app, the experience is pretty poor.

title: Very intuitive
text: These robots are smart for what they are and getting smarter with every software update. There’s always room for improvement and the continued updates will hopefully continue to make these things even better. Would be nice if it could tell when it are a cord or shoe lace and find a way to spit it back out, plus navigating chair legs with low crossbars seems to be an area that could use improvement to, overall one of the best vacuum and mopping robots I’ve seen.

title: I love this 7i
text: It learned our house very well. We are at about 2400 sqft and it takes 2 charges to finish. Probably about 2-1/2 runs. I generally pic about a third of the house and clean it in the morning. I run the main living areas when I’m outside.  I love the self cleaning system. I don’t care that it’s loud because it’s about 10 seconds. The roomba itself is moderately loud but I just run it in areas I’m not. The system is awesome

title: Most amazing vacuum ever invented
text:
I have had my Roomba 900 series for about 4 years. It runs Mon, Weds & Fri and does the whole upstairs. We have 6 indoor cats so it is amazing with fur and does the rugs, marble tile and hardwood floors. 
One thing I learned from a friend is change the filter monthly. I do it on the 1st and then I take the rollers out and clean the hair ( I have long hair) out of the ends. Give it a good once over and it’s good for another month!
Saving up for one downstairs.

title: Pleasantly surprised!
text: My wife wanted a Roomba but I was a bit skeptical given the price tag. I have to say “Rhonda” has been great. It was fun watching her learn her way about. She is fastidious and cleans as good or better than we do since she gets under beds, couches, etc ( dust bunnies are her fav food). The fact that she cleans frequently keeps the house much neater than before. App to control her is easy to use as well. Overall, product exceeded expectations!

title: Dead battery
text: While I really like my Roomba, it really aggravates me that when he gets “lost” and can’t find his way home (often) he runs until his battery is dead. When I try to locate him by the convenient tone alert, there is not enough power to connect to the internet preventing the signal Brit sent to allow the tone. So I have to hunt the house looking for him. He is usually under a random bed. Can’t we set it up so the Roomba saves enough power to be located??  Maybe a small battery to run that part of the app??

title: Very impressed
text: We bought two iRobot 3s for our two level house. Our dog is a world champion shedder and keeling up the daily vacuuming was hard. The Robots are automatically scheduled daily and do an amazing job. Two pleasant surprises: 1). They vacuum under beds which are hard to reach with traditional vacuum and 2) the automatic empty feature is brilliant and the dust capture bags last longer than expected (don’t need changing too often).

title: Love the Wi-Fi map
text: Are use this app all the time and it works great! I love being able to hit a button and find my stuck Rhoomba when it makes a tone. The map feature is also terrific and not only lets me know exactly where little Steve is when he stuck but also tells me all of the spots in my house where the Wi-Fi is weak. Little Steve and this app are making my wife happy because I’m finally helping a lot more with the housework well the vacuuming anyway.

title: Should have bought another brand
text: iRobot i7+ does not clean rooms it is suppose to clean it reports job is completed when rooms have not been touched.  Does not clean rooms in the order you program them to be cleaned. App keeps failing, had to reinstall twice lost previous mapping had to retrain iRobot. App states mobile device is not connected to the internet, ensure internet connection is established yet my phone is able to access multiple apps/websites on the internet like as I write this review I am connected to the internet yet iRobot/app states I have no internet connection....absolute overpriced JUNK!

title: Big money waster
text: The Roomba S9 and BraavaJet M6 were the biggest wastes of money. I’m an embarrassed to even admit that I purchased them. With each software update, they continue to get worse. Half the time the stupid vacuum forgets where it is, and can’t find it’s way back to the base. The BraavaJet just makes a streaky mess of the tile floors, leaving wheel tracks all over the place when things dry. Customer service is terrible, and takes an arrogant approach when you try to ask about why the units perform so badly. App is buggy, and could use a lot of improvement. Wish I had never gone down this path. I’ll stick with my 10 year old Dyson upright.

title: iPhone app vs iPad app
text:
I bought the Roomba e6 yesterday and could not connect to wifi with iPhone app. I tried all the tricks, read the reviews from people with the same issue. I decided to try the iPad app before returning the unit. The iPad app worked perfectly for setup.  It did take my phones app a while to update and recognize the Roomba setups but now all is good and the Roomba is doing its thing. 
If they don’t fix their phone app, and you have an iPad, try the iPad app for setup before returning your robot. Shame on the developer for a bad phone interface.

title: No issues LOVE IT!!!
text: I’ve seen people post about issues with their roombas but I have to say, they must not be following the instructions properly. You have to make sure you have a good WiFi connection, check the unit regularly for any clogs or lodged items & make sure you’ve got things picked up that might give the robot problems like cords, cat/dog toys, clothes, etc. We absolutely LOVE both our Roomba vacuum & our Braava Jet mop!

title: More impressive than I expected
text:
I don’t know, quite, what I really expected when my wife and I bought a 980 model - our first Roomba. I guess I was expecting something a little clumsy that would, eventually, do most of the house... sort-of.  But the thing is methodical and meticulous... smarter and more thorough than I expected.

The app is solid, intuitive, and pretty informative. I like the ending “map”that shows what it was able to cover on each run.

I do feel like the app is missing an obvious feature though:  I wish there was a way to store a characterized floor plan, with the ability to identify rooms by name.  I want to be able to tell it to “clean the family room”... but, right now, it does the whole house, or nothing.

Still... pretty impressive that I can push the button and forget about it while it does everything on its own.

title: Comes up a little short
text: Product works very well...  when it works.  The app really needs to be able to override the cliff sensor!  Unit gets quite confused on any carpet with dark pattern stripes.  Can’t vacuum family room without unit getting stuck.  You could set a toddler loose in my house without any peril of a drop, trip or step...  Roomba can’t pull it off without shutting down for fear of falling off a cliff!  It would get 5 glowing stars if I didn’t have to vacuum a couple large area rugs by hand after the Roomba completes its run.  Oh, by the way, it works with Google and Alexa but not Siri! Really… Really?!?!

title: This iRobot is amazing…
text:
We bought 2 due to having a 2!story home… it was one of the best gift I could of bought my wife for Christmas. They scan our home map out our areas and clean. The only thing I wish I could change is a better understanding of the way it cleans it doesn’t always go in order. It sometimes jumps around and misses some areas… 

But overall I love these 2 iRobots…

title: Doesn’t like vent grates
text: We’ve had this thing approximately two months now and it can’t seem to figure out how to negotiate floor vents in our home, which is 100 years old. We like the app and the fact that it maps itself a plan but it doesn’t always finish the job because it gets stuck on the grates. If They could figure out that problem, this thing would be unbeatable but as of now, it’s as dumb as any other thing that you would buy and there’s a lot of manual intervention required

title: Robot seems to have ongoing issues
text: Learning curve is rather steep to get robot functioning for the home. The phone interface should have dedicated pause and cancel buttons, not how it is now(if I have to reboot the system, buttons disappear). The shortcomings are small but the cost of the system isn’t. Multiple problems with the robot forgetting the map. But when it works it is great to have around. My review is not final as I think it takes a while to see just how hard it is to get the bugs out.

title: Can’t save room labels
text:
We mapped the house took 2 days. We saved a couple room labels and then the app just spins when you say done and never saves it so you can’t schedule vacuuming because you don’t have labels. 

This is the 5th month we had the s9+ and more problems than it’s worth. Broken machine once they sent new insides then 2 months later had to replace the whole robot now can’t save room labels so we either vacuum whole house 3000sq feet or use the old vacuum. 

A broom was way better! Totally disgusted. It seems the cloud is unreachable to save but yes the robot connects right away to the app when started. Ridiculously difficult

title: Life Changer
text:
I was a complete skeptic on the subject of robot vacuum cleaners. We have a yellow Lab & 2 cats that live indoors. No way it could ever work in our house. 
 Now, I tell everyone what a time saver, a back saver, and a marriage saver it is. My house has never been cleaner - underneath all the furniture too! Our iRobot 7+ has become a member of the family and we refer to it quite fondly. “Get out of the way of the Butler!”
Life changer you have to see to believe.

title: Awesome!
text: This i7 is my second Roomba. The “plainer” version was moved to my workshop to vacuum there when my i7 arrived. The i7 took about three weeks to map my house, but now I just choose a room on the app and tell it to clean. The self emptying bin is a lifesaver with my long haired dog because I was having to empty the bin on my older Roomba several times in one cleaning cycle. I have changed the bag in my Roomba station once in three months, so it’s a real timesaver.

title: Junk, Junk, Junk
text: Got a i675 and it worked when I first got it. Then this app started to complain it wouldn’t connect to the robot any more. Reset it and factory reset the 675 and now I can’t get the pile of trash to reconnect. Stupid app won’t reconnect to the dumb vacuum and I can’t complete the setup! Keeps getting stuck after sending WiFi information to robot and I hear the stupid vacuum error tone while the WiFi starts blinking red every time. I hate this thing and the trash application. Their product makes an expensive boat anchor or paper weight but I’d rather just run over the piece of crap and vacuum with something that works like a regular vacuum cleaner!

title: Recent features are going backwards not forward!
text: It used to be that with S9 and other smart vacs you could schedule time, days, rooms AND type of a cleaning with intensity (quiet, detailed or max and other options) associated with the schedule. Like 6AM quiet vacuum around the litter boxes so we come down clean “downstairs” at 7 AM. Detailed vacuum when we leave the house etc. That is no longer possible and requires me to either wake up the whole family with vacuum noise or fumble endlessly with with app each time I want cleaning setting a global setting of vacuum intensity. This shows the PMs at iRobot do not actually use the product in their homes. I could go on and on.

title: The best of the best
text:
I bought this vacuüm a few years ago after staying at a friend's house for the summer that had the same one. I couldn’t believe how great it picked up everything until I saw it firsthand. It cleans very well, goes back to the charging station when it needs to. 
This vacuüm has been a personal lifesaver, I have chronic back pain so manually vacuuming for me is out. I highly recommend this iRobot

title: Great product! Can’t live without it.
text: I love my roomba and how easy it makes life especially with two kids and a hairy dog. Please make a setting for it to NOT beep and tell me it’s stuck or the battery is low in the middle of the night. The automatic timer is great for when I forget to set it. And the machine itself seems like it can put up with a good amount of abuse. Well built, sturdy, and I’m amazed at how much it picks up every single day. Not sure how I lived without it before.

title: Great Robots. Buggy App
text: We are very happy with our IRobot vacuum and wet mop.  We used the app to create schedules for both.  Unfortunately the app crashes each time I try to modify on of the programmed schedules. I was able to disable the program and create a new one as a work around.  It would be nice to be able to delete the old schedule, but I cannot get to that option before the app crashes.  I’m using a new iPhone 12 pro max with the latest updates.

title: Awesome vacuum
text: Have had the i3 for a couple years now and thoroughly enjoy it. Have it run 3 days a week and while I keep a very clean household, it is a wonder how much it picks up. The functionality of having Alexa control is a nice added feature. A few times running late getting home and having company over I can ask it to turn on and know it will be done when home.

title: What Time is it????
text: Even though the iRobot vacuums very well you would think being on the market as long as I robot has that it would know when there’s a time change so as our time changed an hour I usually have my vacuum set to run at 9 AM but it’s not smart enough to know The time change so it starts an hour earlier than the app tells it to don’t understand.

title: Miami robot
text: I love this vacuum!  I have an older single floor house with hardwood floors and area rugs. This thing is awesome!  I’m very happy that I spent the $800 because it really helps keep my house clean and in order. It gets to areas I normally don’t try and get to and it takes a minimum of my intervention. I only wish the top of the line was available at the time of my purchase because I feel the investment was worth it.

title: Time saver
text:
Does this replace sweeping, my option, no. Does it take 80% of the sweeping away, YES. 
I have a house full, 2 dogs, 4 cats, and 8 people and this is great for day to day maintenance. Saves me so much time to where now I sweep twice a week with the floor cleaning. 
I gave it a 4 star because I am always adjusting the unit so that it charges. The unit finds its way home but very seldom gets back on base so it recharges. Make sure you check the app to see if it docked correctly and getting recharged

title: Doesn’t support landscape but functions ok
text:
The app does the trick when it comes to starting the vacuum or mop. The mapping software isn’t great. The robots roam around aimlessly sometimes. I wonder if it’s cleaning my house or if it’s just taking pictures of the house. 

They just added a carpet detector which isn’t working well. I’ve marked an area where we have a rug that shouldn’t be vacuumed in red. The vacuum still goes over there and gets lost on the rug. 

The best part of this app is that it supports linking it with google assistant to ask it to vacuum the kitchen.

title: Great Product!
text:
This is our third Roomba - one was worked to death, the second now works upstairs, and this one covers the ground floor. The automatic emptying feature is a real improvement in robot vacuums - takes even more work out of keeping clean. The mapping feature surprised us with its accuracy- not sure if we are going to label rooms or not. 

Overall, the best Roomba we’ve had - highly recommended.

title: It’s ok but definitely room for improvement
text: The all works ok most of the time but it’s annoying that buttons and controls just disappear from the screen when the app decides they shouldn’t be there - like the “empty bin” button just goes away if the app decides it’s not available. Even after you place the robot on the base, you have to restart the app several times before it appears.  I’d prefer if it just got grayed out when not available so I don’t have to keep looking for where it is.

title: Utter disappointment
text:
This is the worst app I have ever used. First of all my phones have good wifi and cellular service, but the app refuses to launch saying my device is unable to connect. It will not even open a reasonable user interface. Only a useless popup telling me to retry. I redownloaded the app three times and same result, different phone as well. Nothing works. It should as least inform the user a reasonable root cause. 

After a few failed calls to customer service finally I realized that it must be the service is down. Even with that reason, the app still should allow me to open it up , but it only loads and fails.

title: Sometimes has trouble connecting
text: Other than that we seem to not be connected quite a bit this app is great. We use it often and it’s been helpful in mapping the house and I striving roomba to not go to certain areas where it tends to get stuck or where we have lots of cords it can get stuck on.  It’s also nice to know when there is a problem and is helpful in finding the room a when it’s stuck say, under a bed.

title: Love it!
text:
