Had my Roomba for about 7 months I love it. We have hardwood and tile floors through the majority of our house. We run the Roomba about once a week on the main areas and it really helps with the general cleanliness. 
We run it on the carpet every month or so, and it does a good job on the carpet as well. 
I do empty the bin after every vacuum because I learned the hard way that it keeps going even if the bin is full.

title: ❤️My lifesaver ❤️
text: ❤️Absolutely love my I robot my granddaughter got it set up for me so it maps out all my rooms this little thing is amazing .  I was just diagnosed with cancer and had to have a mastectomy and this was truly a lifesaver for me because I am very particular about my house and now my floors are always clean never have to worry about anybody dropping in❣️ in love with my new little maid❤️ my iRobot is definitely a five star⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Excellent product and great support.
text: Smart Maps are one of its best features.   Would like to see you add ability to remap a room ( after furniture is re-arranged).   Also would be nice if you could add/remove rooms selected while a job was in progress.   That view could also show rooms already completed or in-progress,  making them not selectable to be removed from the active job.

title: Very solid app!
text:
I love the iRobot app with my S9+ and M6, there are some very cool features in it that iRobot thought of that help adapt your robot to your floor plan. Keep out zones, clean zones, dividers...etc. 

If I had some suggestions on how the app could be improved I would love to actually percentages on how much battery is left in my robot and It would also be great if we could assign a cleaning “favorite” to the clean button on the robot itself.

title: Smart!
text: I’m very impressed with how smart roomba is. The app could be a little better. It would be nice if it allowed you to name rooms, and set schedules to clean specific rooms, or combinations of rooms. Clearly Roomba has a pretty good idea of the shape of a house after a few runs. I wish room but I had a bigger dirt receptacle. Our house is less than 2000 ft.², but it usually fills up before completing a run. It does do an outstanding job of cleaning both our hardwood floors and our rugs and carpets.

title: App is good. Wish list:
text: App is fine. What would be helpful is a notification if the Roomba (i7) is stuck and manual controls to get it unstuck or if it could learn that the one spot it constantly gets stuck in isn’t the area to try to cross when there are other areas that work better. Otherwise it sits stuck all day and runs out of battery. I have no idea until I get home and am disappointed that only 1/3 of the job was completed.

title: Amazing.
text:
Serious props to the devs. Robotics programming is far from easy and you all did an amazing job.

I don’t quite understand the return from pause programming. It seems like you can’t trust the user (fair) but can’t you take the map of the room using the sensors? Dunno just a thought. I’m sure there is a good reason.

Anyways, I’d love to buy the team a beer or something if you all are ever in CO. Long shot I know lol

title: AMAZING! Worth every penny!
text: Roomba has made things around the house way way better! It’s such a huge help when you have kids and work full time! We usually set her up after we go to to bed to wake up to clean floors as well as during the day sometimes we run it again since I have a roof let there’s crumbs everywhere! So worth the money tho! It helps me out quite a bit!

title: Mapping Run
text:
To make it work better, do a few mapping runs first. Please let your customer know how important “frequent” mapping run is.

Also it is not easy to find “mapping run” button. You should make it prominent so that your customer can see it on the first page instead having to search for it.

With multiple mapping runs, the map will get better and better.

title: Easy Peasy
text:
Love being able to use my phone from anywhere (grocery store, friends house anywhere) to run Roomba. Also love being able to tell it which room to clean. Don’t always need the whole house done.
Didn’t give five stars because it does miss dirt frequently, but overall it does a pretty good job.
I’ve only had it a couple of months so we’ll see how well it holds up. My original lasted almost 10 years!!! Fingers crossed 😄

title: Floors feel great!!!
text: I have two dogs that shed like crazy. We aren’t used to inside animals so it drives us insane. The roomba with the auto emptier thing is heaven on earth. If I would leave before, almost always the unit would need emptied before I got home. Now I come to clean floors and ready to go again. Occasionally there is something stuck in the empty process but normally it’s done a great job!!! Love love love

title: Crazy Hazel
text: Hazel is a little erratic. Sometimes she comes back and does the same area 3 maybe 4 times and doesn’t do other areas.  It takes her more that 5 - 6 hours to do my small house because she does some areas many times.  She’ll do part of my bedroom and do some in the kitchen and then go back to bedroom,  then do part of one bathroom and do some of the sunroom and go back to bedroom and then do some of living room and go back to bedroom .  There is no rhyme nor reason for her routine.  Sometimes she misses whole areas.

title: Overpriced short lived boondoggle
text: We have multiple roombas. The most recent is the pretty expensive S9+. In the two years we’ve had it, we’ve had to replace multiple part on it from premature wear(with twice weekly normal use). The bin often has errors and the lid keeps saying it’s not closed. Support has been weak, with one telling me to pry on the connectors in the lid to make a better connection. For something this expensive, it should last more than a year or two, and in that time  should function without constant errors and breakdowns. I am extremely unimpressed with roomba and will be trying other options.

title: Don’t update!!!!!
text: I’ve had my roomba about a month now and it’s worked flawlessly. Until this morning. When I went to my iPhone app to set it to clean I was prompted to “upgrade” the app to the latest version. I really wasn’t given a choice. So OK. I updated. Now the app tells me I am offline and need to connect to the internet in order to clean. NONE of my other WiFi devices are having this problem. So I started the vac manually when all I really needed was to clean my kitchen and front hall via the map zone. Didn’t pay $$$$ for this vacuum for this. My old robot vac could be doing the same job right now. Please fix this app.

title: Terrible App
text:
I bought my Roomba three days ago. The app says it is always cleaning even when it is docked and charging. App says it is never charged even when left on the dock all night. App says it has cleaned 37 times and I have only had it three days. App says it needs to update the Roomba and schedules the update but never updates. Poor app or messed up Roomba, I have no idea.

**Update**

I was shocked to actually get a response from the developers. They took down my info and answered my questions. The Roomba did finally update. It works just fine now.

title: Easiest way to use Roomba
text: You can do everything on this app: set your roomba vacuum or mop to start a job, or spot clean, or create a cleaning schedule, and so much more. It even reminds you when to clean the parts and how frequently go replace them if needed AND shows you a video clip on how it’s done. I’ve been using the robots along with the app for about a year and I can’t live without any of them.

title: Love it!  Cleans up Pet fur wonderfully!
text: I am temporarily in an apartment with a concrete floor.  I bought an iRobot Roomba petTo help clean it regularly from my golden retriever who sheds a lot. It works great. It’s under everything mapped out the entire apartment and allowed me even to section out rooms.  It even goes back to the base station to empty at least once when vacuuming every other day. I can’t tell you how happy I am with this thing.

title: A savior
text: Having dark wood floors was a horrible decision I made years ago, it shows everything. Owning my own business doesn’t allow me much time to clean the floors. I purchased iRobot vacuum and mop, together they keep my floors looking brand new, once the vacuum is complete, it tells the mop to get busy and I come home to a beautiful looking floor. This is one of the best decisions I have made in a very long time.

title: Had a major glitch with software
text: Now that the glitch with the software is straighted out it runs like a charm but kept forgetting where the home base was located and just stopping whenever the battery went dead. I think it is finally fixed after several months I finally called the service hotline & they knew almost immediately what was happening. So all that frustration for nothing when I should have acted sooner.

title: Location problems
text: When this thing works it’s wonderful however I have had location problems it disconnected from cloud once and I had to remove and reload robot to fix now last three jobs he’s had a location error of some kind and goes back home after just a little cleaning went through trouble shooting even moved home but he did it again this morning. He’s also missing spaces in floor that he seems to go all around  but never gets.

title: Does the job
text:
It’s very useful but very noisy and time consuming. It takes too long to clean the room but definitely does the job . It doesn’t do well on corners also need frequent checkup of wheels for any debris . 

After using for few months I noticed it is important to check occasionally if it is docked properly for charging if it runs out of charge completely it’s a very tedious process to reset not as easy as instructions suggest.

title: Worked for 3 days
text:
Received my new i3 Sunday. I had no problems setting it up with the app and it worked great Monday and Tuesday.

Now my app keeps telling me that my mobile device is not connected to WiFi. I have reset my modem and router, deleted and re installed the app, restarted my phone multiple times and it still will not let me in. 
 
I even installed the app in my iPad, which has no cellular so WiFi only, and while I can stream movies,  the app keeps saying my mobile device is not connected to WiFi. 

Considering that this model is not programmable at all with out the app, this is a real problem.

The i3 replaced a 6yo 600 series that at least I can still program a schedule in on the vacuum itself. 

This is my 3rd roomba and this app is the only disappointing experience I’ve had.

Why would anyone make such nice, expensive, vacuums that only work with an app that clearly needs an update?

title: App Needs Work
text:
Whenever I open the app, I’m INSTANTLY greeted with error messages and red icons saying the app can’t connect to the Roomba. Then, in a couple seconds, the connection is made. So there wasn’t really anything wrong after all. 

If it takes a couple of seconds the establish a connection that’s fine. So then build a couple second delay into the launch of the app so I’m not peppered with error messages that aren’t really errors every time I launch it.

Also, the two sets of settings (cleaning prefs and settings) need to be put in one place. The leftmost icon should be a gear with ALL settings/prefs, and the rightmost should be a question mark with just care and help. 

I only have one network in my house, so I don’t understand why I keep getting errors that my phone and Roomba are not on the same network. 

The cleaning map is excellent, and so is the wi-fi map. And I love my 980.

title: Wonderful Robot 980
text:
Great vacuum a few things could be tweaked, like it would be nice if the app. Would allow one to control what parts of your house you would like cleaned.
After a complete vacuum I personally only need certain areas cleaned once a week and others daily. Also the dirt trap is a bit of a struggle cleaning out.
I’ve only had this vacuum a week so these are things that stood out to me.
But, all aside this vacuum is freedom, I have back problems and this product is my answer to a daily drudge.

title: Timesaver
text: I love my Roomba! I have many pets so I almost need constant vacuuming. I run the Roomba daily and our house always looks great. I also love the app that gives updates if the vacuum is stuck, needs its bin emptied or is charging. It’s a great investment to save time and clean in areas you might not get to without moving furniture. I actually don’t sneeze anymore when I wake up, under the bed is super clean now!

title: Love the Romba
text: I bought an i7 for our vacation house and I loved it so much, I bought an i3 for our house. I love the mapping feature. It is very accurate!  It recognizes our stairs and has not fallen. I bought another brand (rhymes with bark) and that one always gets stuck on the stair and the battery dies. The Romba can block areas on its mapping. The other brand cannot. I just wish the Rombas weren’t so expensive.

title: Amazing Job
text: IRobot is exceptional. I really couldn’t figure out how in the world it would do the job… but it surely does. My floors have never been this clean. I have a large black lab dog that shed’s constantly…. No more hair to be found on the floors. That makes it worth it in my book. I highly recommend this product for anyone who would like a little housekeeping help. You won’t be disappointed. David Florida

title: It’s great but everything can be better.
text:
It’s a great app with the iRobot, but like everything thing else in life. Things could alwas be better. One thing is the app won’t let me update my iRobot nor update my map. Also it seems like the robot is still ramming into items that hasn’t moved since I got
This thing. It’s been a month, running it three times a week. Maybe it needs a update to fix it but idk. But all and all it’s great.

title: iRobot changed my life
text: I suffer from allergies and asthma and I can’t believe I didn’t get the iRobot sooner. The robot gets all the dust underneath the beds and chairs that my housekeeper doesn’t always get to and I can run it every day and keep my house free of dust and allergens. I’m very happy with my iRobot what the automatic been disposal. It’s super easy just pulled a little couch out throw it away and put in a new one. No dust and debris flying around.

title: Can’t find its way to the Home station no matter what I try
text: The first six months I own my Roomba 900 series it flawlessly cleaned recharge went back out and cleaned until the job is done after six months began not finding its way back home. Call customer service had suggestions and none of them worked. I put Home station literally in the middle of the room in the house to see if I can find its way back. Never did. Super disappointed I paid a lot of money for that machine. I’m definitely going to try another manufacture I give up on Roomba‘s

title: Dog hair
text: With our four dogs and two cats our iRobot is a necessity! It does a great job in keeping up with all of the hair. Now with that in mind I do have to clean the iRobot weekly, but that is the least of my worries cause without it I’ll have to vacuum daily. It’s not so good on carpet, but hard wood floors is great, in which we have all hard wood floors. It’s a must to have if your weeks are hard going like my wife and I are!

title: Ruby
text: I love this Roomba. I’ve had her a couple years and she cleans as well now as when I first got her. I take very good care of her and make sure to clean her after every use. This may be operator error, but I wish she would clean room by room, rather than randomly vacuuming from one room to the next and back again. She has great battery stamina and although she does buzz about Willy Nilly, the floors are clean when she’s finished. I really want the mop!

title: Beware of mapping features toggle button
text: My map wouldn’t load on my iPhone even though it showed on my iPad. So one of the help suggestions was to “ensure of mapping features is turned on” beware if you toggle the “mapping features” button off then back on it will delete your map. There is a pop-up that says you’ll delete your map, but it’s not clear that it’s permanently deleted.   iRobot does not have any kind of cloud back up for maps. So now I have to re-map my entire home. Having a cloud back up of the map seems intuitively reasonable.

title: Problems with iPhone 11
text: If you have a device like the iPhone 11 that connects to the 5GHz Wifi band and you can’t manually select the 2.4GHz with band from your router (because it doesn’t have a distinct SSID from the 5GHz band), you might not be able to use this app to set up your robot.  I’m still working through this with iRobot customer support.  With my availability being very limited when iRobot customer support is available, it’s taking some time.  But I wanted to warn people who might be in a similar situation.  Because it’s honestly probably not worth the time to work around this issue.  Not at all a time saver so far.
